For all he was keeping himself at an emotional arm's length from the man, the idea of him having any kind of ulterior motive just... hurt. "Yeah, that's... notable. And suspicious." Pursing his lips slightly, he exhaled through his nose. "...Interrogating him about any suspicions right off the bat will probably put him on the defense. Maybe we just continue to play nice for now, see if we can get answers through casual conversation." He closed his eyes with a grimace. "...I've been thinking about the dream Anubis sent me. He was worried for me, made it a point to remind me I have everything I need. Maybe Ludin is part of the reason for that warning..."
Daarka 3/20/2023 11:34 PM
Skena leaned in to rest her shoulder against his in quiet sympathy. "... For whatever it's worth... I don't... immediately feel like he's up to no good. I think his sentiments in regards to you and your relationship--or lack thereof--were authentic. It's... very possible that there are innocent explanations for the weirdness. For example... the first lie I pointed out, where he couldn't have been telling the truth about how he heard of glimpses of you in the north. He was clearly lying because he didn't feel comfortable outing himself as having ties to a cult. But when you called him out on that exact detail, he didn't fight it. Didn't make excuses, really. Didn't use it as an opportunity to try to hand you a pamphlet and break into a speech about how great Fenrir was. In fact... he kind of did nothing but talk bad about the Blackswords. And Fenrir. He expressed a desire for none of that to affect you, and he looked... pretty bummed to hear that it had." She sighed softly, quiet a moment, before continuing, "... On that note. We already knew Fenrir was a fiend; he has to be, if his influence produces tieflings. But the detail that he is a demon specifically was odd to me. It could just be a matter of... ignorance from those who spoke of him to Ludin, of people just using incorrect terminology because they didn't know the difference. But it makes a notable difference to me. Devils and fiends that originate from the nine hells are innately evil--but innately lawful. Think of Axa; Jaska bound her via a contract, and within that contract, she was forbidden from bringing harm or death to anyone under his protection. Which includes anyone he simply doesn't want her to kill--like you and me. Think of how many times we've glimpsed her tantrums where it looked like she wanted nothing more than to run us through with something sharp. But--it's like Gummy and the parameters I establish in his mind. She can't. She can't cross that line, she's a creature of law. Law doesn't mean morality or virtue, but it means there is a structure of rules and standards and procedure that she lives by. Demons are creatures of innate chaos. It's easiest to see the difference when looking at the motivations of fiends: Devils seek to corrupt mortals, because our souls are their currency. They live and breathe contracts, negotiations, politics, charismatic manipulation, all of that. They are conquerors, but through cunning schemes and sabotage. They are strategists. They want to corrupt and dominate the world. Demons, however, only want destruction for destruction's sake. They don't operate under a system of some sort--they don't even reside in the nine hells. In fact, devils and demons hate one another and are just as much at war with each other as they are with celestials. Demons don't want to rule the world, they want to tear it limb from limb just to taste the blood, even if they destroy themselves in the process." She shrugged a little. "... Not that I think that has very much to do with Ludin himself, but... I would be remiss not to speak on that point. If Fenrir is truly a demon and not some other manner of fiend, it may be useful to keep in mind what that means for what kind of entity he is. But again... hard to say if that's an uneducated label or a deliberate one Ludin was repeating. Beyond that..."
11:34 PM
Chewing her lip a moment, she reigned her thoughts back on track. "... When he pulled out his amulet, I cast a spell to ensure it was nothing more than what I expected it to be. And it wasn't. Just a simple amulet for creating that elven illusion over his person. But I didn't cast the spell from myself; I cast it from Gummy and sent him outside to where Ludin had dropped the sword he said was enchanted. The magic wasn't the same as something where I could identify exactly what that enchantment did--all I can ascertain from it is schools of magic. But the sword had... a very odd signature of necromancy. It was... minor? But what necromancy was there was so deeply concentrated. It gave me the impression that the magic is not always applicable when the sword is used, but when it is, it might be something deeply potent. I rarely see it concentrated that much." She snorted a little, shrugging. "But necromancy is also the school responsible for healing magics. I would be a hypocrite to assume something sinister there based on that detail alone. Worth mentioning, though, I guess."
Dakota 3/27/2023 8:21 PM
Kaleva let out a little hum of thought. "I guess it'd make sense that Fenrir would be classified as a demon rather than a devil. The entire reason why Fenrir was bound in chains was to keep him from wreaking havoc throughout the world. Legends say that when Ragnarök comes, he will break free and run throughout the world, devouring and destroying everything in his path. That sounds more in line with a demon of chaos than a devil of order. "As far as his sword goes... I guess it's something to keep in mind, but if he actually wants to develop a relationship with me, and disapproves of the Blackswords and Fenrir... I don't know what other kind of ulterior motive he might have. But I don't think any of it seems intended to harm me or us?"
Daarka 3/27/2023 8:29 PM
Skena nodded with a little shrug. "I'm inclined to agree. Again, I don't... I don't immediately get some feeling like he's up to no good. I would advise you to just not wholeheartedly lean in to trusting him yet, but I think you're already of that mindset." She sighed softly. "... I hope it's all good intentions. I hope he's nice and... can offer your life enrichment in some way. It's too soon to tell, but... that's what I'm hoping for. A lot of what he said did sound genuine to me, there were just... those little inconsistencies, or holes in his stories, or time unaccounted for. And it could be nothing. It could just mean that he's used to lying or stretching the truth due to whatever hardships have shaped him, even if he's not trying to do anything nefarious." A beat. "I think I believe him when he said he's never been to the desert, at least. And... I think that'd mean... I mean, presumably... that in the worst case scenario, his ulterior motives have to do with Fenrir and nasty stuff from the north. And... I don't know. I think we can handle that, if that's what comes of this." She reached out to gently slip her hand around his, letting their joined hands hang between them softly. "Anubis was right. You have everything you need. If he was some agent of Fenrir--what could he possibly offer you that would actually tempt you from your current life?"
Dakota 3/27/2023 8:33 PM
He gave her fingers a little squeeze. "I don't think there is anything. I'm content with my life here. It's everything I wanted. I have you, the dogs, this house. A nearby village where we're welcomed and accepted. Friends, financial stability." Kaleva shook his head. "Even if Ludin and I develop a good relationship, I don't think I could ever view him as a father. I already have one in Anubis."
Daarka 3/27/2023 8:38 PM
Skena nodded a little. "... I mean. You know you best. But even as close as I am to you and as deeply as I know you... I can't... think of anything. Nothing that would make me worry about it enticing you. So... I guess... until we have reason to think differently or reassess the issue... I don't see any harm in carefully proceeding. Not... completely lowering our guard, until we have reason to feel confident doing so. But... giving it a chance, I think. If this is some ploy to get you to join the Blackswords, I don't see it working at all. And I doubt they'd want to... I don't know. Destroy you if you don't join. If you have Fenrir's blood, that'd seem sacrilegious. So what are they gonna do? And that's... of course assuming that Ludin is here on their behest, with that goal in mind."
Dakota 3/27/2023 8:41 PM
"Since he's worked with the Blackswords, I'm inclined to think he probably won't be too put off by the whole werewolf bit either," Kaleva mused. "But I don't really feel inclined to bringing that up unless it's really necessary."
Daarka 3/27/2023 8:46 PM
"I don't blame you, but..." she squinted a little. "I wonder if he already knows. He might not. But... I don't think I'd be surprised if he did. You disclosed you're a blood hunter, and even if you had not, he probably saw your scars. And the Blackswords we killed were... ex-blood hunters, I suppose. If he's familiar with werewolves and blood hunters, he might be able to put two and two together." A pause. "Besides--don't the different Orders have slightly different goals? Like... They're all fighting monsters of some sort, but... I always got the impression the different Orders all served different niches."
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:07 PM
"Sort of. I mean, everyone undergoes the Hunter's Bane ritual from the start... It's the ritual that enables us to perform blood magic, if we survive it. Fey, fiends, and undead are the main sort of creatures we fight against. The Ghostslayers excel against the undead. Lycans use our transformations to fight. Mutants specialize in assessing the strengths and weaknesses of whatever they come across and can alter their biology appropriately through alchemy and toxic elixirs called mutagens. Those of the Profane Soul are similar to warlocks in that they make pacts with lesser evils to combat greater threats." He reached up to scratch at his scarred cheek absently. "They each have their different interests, but the goals between the orders are all largely the same. Combat the evils that threaten innocent folk and the rest of the world."
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:21 PM
"Hm. So he could think you're of a different Order." She shrugged a little. "If I were him... I'd probably assume Order of the Lycan, just... based on context clues. Either way... I don't think it particularly matters. If he's already rubbed elbows with lycans, it'd be weird of him to take issue with you being one." She was quiet a moment, squinting a little. "... Maybe that's why he sounded so surprised to hear you were a blood hunter. It almost sounded like... like he didn't realize blood hunters could be a good thing. Or maybe had just never heard them described like you described them. Whatever it was, he looked kind of... pleasantly surprised about it."
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:25 PM
Kaleva let out a little 'hmph,' his expression wryly amused. "Part of why I didn't hesitate to transform to fight the werewolves that attacked us. I had to make sure the rest of the group got the right impression and realized those two were outliers. It's always a delicate dance, to use the magic and abilities we do and not succumb to the darkness, but those that do are cast out of the Orders."
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:27 PM
"Mm. I wonder what the lycans we had killed would have described the Order as. I wonder if they tried to portray it a certain way. At some point, maybe I'll ask Ludin what his impression had previously been of the Order; I'm curious. Not that it matters."
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:30 PM
"Dogs on a leash, probably," he mused, shrugging and yawning as he went to make his way back to the bedroom. "...He mentioned he had several names, too. You think there's a reason for that, other than trying to avoid trouble associated with a particular name?"
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:34 PM
Skena shuffled after him, shrugging. "Dunno. That wasn't terribly strange to me... If he was wearing an illusion throughout the entire duration of a romantic relationship, and then he ran away from that completely, and then he at some point ended up in a cult--or at least mingling with one--I can imagine how it would have been natural to adopt various aliases throughout the years. I wonder if he'd be resistant to sharing the other names. Not entirely sure what that would mean, though."
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:37 PM
"Maybe he did that tiefling thing of taking on a... whatever those are called, the word-names?" He paused and leveled a flat stare on the three dogs that somehow managed to take up practically every square inch of their already oversized bed. "Really?" he groaned, and all three tails started wagging.
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:38 PM
Skena looked up, snorting softly. "Virtue names," she corrected, before breaking from him to go unceremoniously crawl onto the bed, helping herself between the crevices of dog. "I'm gonna smother you completely if you don't move, Finch."
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:43 PM
Finch let out a long groan and rolled onto his back, stretching leggies out and throwing his head back. Meanwhile, Kaleva was arguing with Song, trying to get her to move over while she argued back that she clearly did not want to, that she was comfortable, that he was clearly an abusive owner and her rights were being denied, and he didn't understand how hard her life was and why should she have to move when he could just sleep somewhere else-- "Waaawaaawwaaaaawwaaawaaaa~" "Song." Song huffed dramatically and rolled onto her feet, stalking over to tuck in on the other side of Atreyu instead, and Kaleva burrowed in to spoon Skena after she settled, tucking an arm over her middle and a leg between hers.
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:47 PM
Skena couldn't help but grin throughout it all, nestling in against Kaleva with Finch as her little spoon. "We got some very noisy pillows. They also shed an unusual amount," she observed, her body easily relaxing amidst all the warmth she was now sandwiched in.
Dakota 3/27/2023 9:55 PM
"I may have over-fluffed them," Kaleva murmured with a snicker. "I'll attack them with the de-shedding brush again tomorrow. Might even see about getting an undercoat rake for Yiska's wolves, they were looking pretty tattered."
Daarka 3/27/2023 9:56 PM
She snorted at that. "You think he'd be interested in one? I'm always hesitant to offer him any sort of... I don't know. Help, for starters, but also just. Things from civilization. I almost feel like it's insulting to him to do so, but I... just very much don't innately understand what his life is like."
Dakota 3/27/2023 10:05 PM
Kaleva thought about that for a minute. "...Maybe if you could make one out of bone? That way it's still technically natural, but also helps improve their quality of life. We could show him how it works on the huskies, and he could decide if he wants to take it."
Daarka 3/27/2023 10:09 PM
"I could try. It'd be tricky to get the little tines so small... When I shape bone like that, it's like sculpting it with my fingers, and... I might be able to make them that fine, but it'd be tricky."
Dakota 3/27/2023 10:17 PM
"If you want to. We could always just try a metal comb first." Yawning again, he closed his eyes and nosed into her hair.
Daarka 3/27/2023 10:18 PM
"A problem for future us," Skena dismissed easily, settling in as well as he yawned in her ear. "Night..."
Dakota 3/27/2023 10:35 PM
"G'night," he mumbled groggily, drifting off to sleep shortly after.
Dakota 4/4/2023 11:23 AM
------------------- Nearly two weeks had passed since that night. Ludin had taken a couple days to work up the courage to go back, and Kaleva had taken him around the territory he was familiar with to locate a place where Ludin's house would be built. Once they had settled on a location, the work began to cut down trees for lumber and to clear an area to build on. The blueprints were made, the foundation laid, Kaleva including Ludin in every step of the way and teaching him what needed to be done. In this way they sort of... Learned to be around each other in a way that wasn't so filled with uncertainty and questions that they weren't sure they were ready to ask, or get the answers to. Spring was arriving in earnest now, and Kaleva finished hanging up a tarp over the fire pit to give them shelter from the rain that had suddenly come pouring down. He climbed down from the tree and grumbled as he settled in to sit next to the fire, tossing another chunk of wood on. "Jeez, that came out of nowhere. Tre, can you grab my pack and bring it over? It's getting close to lunch time anyway." The hound boofed and turned to trot over to where the pack had been set, picking it up by one of the straps and carrying it under the meagre shelter, trying to squeeze himself in where it was dry. The huskies seemed to not have the slightest care about the rain, and were joyfully running around and rolling in mud puddles.
Daarka 4/4/2023 4:33 PM
Ludin continued to be a bit of an awkward presence, but it was clear how hard he was trying. Like a wild animal that only knew to flee in the face of tension, but still found itself craving a kind touch, with the instinct warring with the desire. Even if Kaleva had his shirt off while he worked, Ludin did not seem keen on following suit, though he did shed his heavier layers. The most he would dress down, however, still left him in a long-sleeved tunic, with glimpses of bandaging peaking under the fabric covering his left shoulder. He didn‚Äôt seem much accustomed to manual labor, and certainly didn‚Äôt have the musculature his son had developed, but he was willing to try everything handed to him, tentative and uncertain though he was throughout it all. Skena had not wandered far amidst all this, either. Until she was wholeheartedly confident Ludin wasn‚Äôt up to anything problematic, she refused to leave Kaleva entirely alone with him. She helped out with what they were doing where she could‚Äîand when it exceeded her capabilities, she managed the dogs and made sure they stayed out of trouble (though she had given up on trying to keep them out of the mud when that proved a losing battle). When Atreyu squeezed in under the tarp, she burrowed into the curl of his body, grateful for the warmth he provided (though he was pretty bony. Sharp dog). As Kaleva set up the tarp for them to take shelter under, Ludin found a place to sit towards the edge of the sheltered space, as if not wanting to be (potentially uncomfortably) close to the rest of them if he could help it. If the rest of his mannerisms were anything to go by, this was more likely some subconscious desire to not curse them with his presence more than an aversion to them. ‚ÄúI put some cookies in there when you were packing up food,‚Äù Skena pointed to it as the bag was rummaged through. ‚ÄúI just want one; you two can split the rest.‚Äù (edited)
Dakota 4/4/2023 8:56 PM
"I thought I smelled something sweet. Thank you." Kaleva pulled out the cookies, unwrapping them from the little cloth and passing one over to Skena, setting the rest between himself and Ludin. He pulled out the sandwiches he'd made earlier, offering one over to Ludin as well and unwrapping the other for himself. Thick slices of grainy bread housed generous cuts of grilled pheasant, tomato, avocado, lettuce, cheese, and bacon. Well-trained as he was, Atreyu simply laid there curled around Skena and made no attempt toward any of the food. To Ludin, he asked, "How are your hands holding up? Any blisters?"
Daarka 4/4/2023 9:00 PM
Ludin took the sandwich with his usual, quiet humility, taking in the look and smell of it a moment with a bit of appreciation. At the question, he shifted the food to one hand to look at the palm of his other. "... Don't think so. Not used to this kind of work, but... no damage yet." He paused, glancing briefly at Skena and her singular cookie, then back at the sandwiches he and Kaleva had been served. But if he had concerns or thoughts on the matter, he ultimately decided it wasn't his place to voice them, and he silently tucked in to the meal.
Dakota 4/4/2023 9:08 PM
Kaleva nodded. "Good. If you're proficient with swords, you've probably built up enough calluses that your hands will be fine." He watched the huskies splashing about and having a great time getting soaked and dirty, wryly amused in the sort of way where it was cute watching them have fun, but he knew he was going to get filthy cleaning them off later.
Daarka 4/4/2023 9:18 PM
On that note, Ludin's sword currently sat in its sheath, on the ground off to the side with the outer layers he had shed earlier. Skena eyed it thoughtfully at Kaleva's mention of it while she chewed on a bite of her cookie, squinting a little. It at least looked like a fairly normal sword. After a few moments longer of companionable, chewing silence, Skena swallowed and spoke up. "From what you've shared--" (Ludin immediately had his eyes on the small aasimar, watching her with an expression that seemed braced for some sort of accusation) "--I didn't particularly take you for the sort who would have had the means or desire to treat themselves to enchanted weaponry," she began, her tone light and very non-accusatory as she clearly picked up on his immediately cautious demeanor. "On the note of swords and all. Does that one have a story to it, then? Or am I just being too presumptuous?" A beat, before she added, "If that's not too personal to ask, of course." Ludin swallowed his bite of food, side-eyeing the sheathed sword a moment. "... Not much of a... story in the entertaining sense. You're... right in that I wouldn't have had the means. Or inclination. It was... originally a loan from a friend. They died before I could give it back," he murmured, his words just soft enough that Skena and Kaleva had to listen carefully to catch them over the sound of the rain pattering on the tarp above.
Dakota 4/4/2023 9:23 PM
"My condolences," Kaleva murmured, his gaze drawn to the sword as well. "What sort of enchantment does it have on it?" His own tone was casual, just making small talk while he munched on his sandwich, his tufted tail tucked neatly around his crossed legs, though it looked a bit sad and limp from the sudden downpour having soaked it.
Daarka 4/4/2023 9:28 PM
Ludin gave a small half-shrug. "... Honestly, I... couldn't tell you. I've rarely used it, and... nothing's ever happened out of the ordinary when I have. The original owner... never told me what it was. Just that it was magic. For all I know... he meant it figuratively."
Dakota 4/4/2023 9:34 PM
He blinked thoughtfully while chewing on his food, looking over at Skena. "Are you able to identify the magic on it? Or do we know anyone with that ability?"
Daarka 4/4/2023 9:42 PM
Despite the fact that Skena and Kaleva were clearly both working in tandem to gently manipulate the conversation into getting answers they had been bothered by, the sheepish little half-smile on her face was wholly authentic and entirely separate from that train of thought; the expression of someone proud of themselves in a bit of a shy way. "I've... actually been working on that lately. I've been really feeling that lack of that particular breed of magic more and more lately, so I figured I'd start researching and practicing to try to expand in that direction. I've... not actually tried it before, but I could give it a shot. If you don't mind? Only with your consent, of course," she added to Ludin, her little smile giving way to a more polite and courteous expression. Ludin hesitated a moment, looking unprepared for the mystery to be solved right on the spot. But he conceded easily enough, giving a little nod. "If it's... not a trouble, I don't mind," he replied softly. Skena nodded to him once, leaning forward and reaching to delicately pull the sword closer, and then back into her lap as she settled against Atreyu once more. "This will take a bit of time, it doesn't exactly happen instantaneously," she murmured, rummaging in her own bag for a moment, before pulling out her half-minion journal--one Kaleva would be familiar with, but which Ludin stared at a little, given its... eyes and teeth. "You two carry on and just ignore me for a bit." (edited)
Dakota 4/4/2023 9:52 PM
Kaleva nodded and went back to eating his sandwich, though in just a couple more bites he'd wolfed it down with a bit more speed than usual. Apparently he'd worked up a bit of an appetite. Noting Ludin's stare, he sent him a bit of a knowing smirk, not mocking, just... amused, because he could appreciate that it was a bit of an unsettling thing if you weren't accustomed to it. "Was your friend also from Holbrook?"
Daarka 4/4/2023 9:54 PM
Skena seemed to have momentarily forgotten about the weirdness of her tome, which opened itself up in her lap as golden light began to shimmer around her eyes and fingers, soft mutterings in celestial under her breath. Ludin stared a moment longer, before looking back to Kaleva at his question. "... Sort of. Closer to the border. Don't actually... remember what side we were properly on."
Dakota 4/4/2023 10:04 PM
Helping himself to a cookie, he hummed as he munched it down, licking the crumbs off his fingers after. "We have some friends from Holbrook that were part of the Flamekeepers. Were you ever involved in any of that?" He... sincerely doubted it, but it was worth asking anyway.
Daarka 4/4/2023 10:06 PM
It seemed to take Ludin a moment to recognize the word, before he gave a little shake of his head. "... Knew some who were. Never really... I... I wasn't the person who was... gonna bring hope to anyone. Could barely help myself." As usual... he didn't sound remotely proud of the fact. Finishing off his own sandwich, he brushed the crumbs off on his pant leg. "... You make that? It was good."
Dakota 4/4/2023 10:13 PM
Kaleva smiled at that. "Thanks. I hunted and cooked the meat and made the bread. The cheese came from one set of neighbors, the veggies from another. We have a good trade system in place... Though it's less trading and more that we just give whatever surplus we have and receive the same in return."
Daarka 4/4/2023 10:15 PM
"Sounds nice... Tasted better than some of the stuff I've paid for." He was quiet a moment, looking like he was fumbling to try to find conversation; it clearly was not something he was good at. "Those friends of yours... how'd you meet, then...?"
Dakota 4/4/2023 10:27 PM
Kaleva ran a hand over his mouth and chin in thought. "All of the tieflings in Fielbarry wind up meeting each other at some point, I think, but... hmm... Oh, right. So, Skena and I work with a guild in Fielbarry that sends us out on missions trying to locate aether crystals and the like. While Skena was on a mission, she wound up wounded and inflicted with a curse that was having some worrying lingering effects on her ability to remember and process information. The guild master directed us to an elf named Cassiana, who was living with a tiefling named Hiraeth at the time. So we met and befriended them, and when Cass was reunited with her tiefling husband and his parents, we got to know them as well. We get vegetables, herbs, mushrooms, and such from Hiraeth. Cass and Nils' parents, Margret and Stefan, have a cow and give us cheese, milk, and other dairy products. They were friends of Marko too."
Daarka 4/4/2023 10:32 PM
"Huh." A pause. "... Small world, I guess. Smaller than I've known it to be, anyways. Glad you have... good neighbors like that, though." He glanced aside towards Skena again, taking note of how the magic had progressed to glowing, golden runes of light along the length of the sword's sheath, though the aasimar's attention remained firmly fixated on the task at hand, and she didn't look to be listening to the conversation at all. However Ludin felt about the ritual stayed ambiguous behind a relatively unreadable expression, before he looked back to Kaleva. "... Can't say I... really have much to offer for trade..."
Dakota 4/4/2023 10:37 PM
Sitting forward and propping his elbow on his knee, he rested his chin on his fist and looked to Ludin. "Would you want to be part of it? If you don't already have a niche, something you're good at doing that could be offered in service to others, we could maybe suggest something. You'll probably wind up getting gifts of various goods anyway, regardless of whether or not you had anything to offer in return, if you wind up becoming acquainted with our neighbors."
Daarka 4/4/2023 10:39 PM
Ludin's pupilless gaze shifted around a little awkwardly, not seeming to quite land on Kaleva. "... Don't really... know what'd I'd be able to give. Never had much time to develop... skills like that, I suppose. Probably be easier if you folks didn't bother with me on that front. Not fair for me to take and give nothing back if... if that's your whole arrangement."
Dakota 4/4/2023 10:51 PM
"I'd imagine the concept of a community has been a foreign concept," Kaleva murmured, a half-smile turning his lips. "I get it. I'm still adjusting to it myself. But Stefan maintains that a community is any group of people who support each other without expectation of anything in return. If you can give to or help your neighbors, you should. If you don't have the means, it's not held against you. But that doesn't mean you're undeserving of being supported and shared with. The things we give to each other are what we make in excess of what we need. It would go to waste otherwise. Granted, I'll hunt and fish in excess of what I need specifically to provide for my neighbors as well, but that's not a hardship for me."
Daarka 4/4/2023 11:14 PM
Ludin shook his head a little, almost in a subconscious gesture, though a moment later he made some mumbled response of, "If you say so..." He drifted off as there was a soft inhale from Skena, followed immediately by a bit of coughing as if she had swallowed something wrong. He looked over with a blankly concerned expression as the light of the ritual's magic faded, and she quickly regained her composure. "Sorry, I--I did that thing where I choked on my spit a little. I'm fine," she explained with a quick smile. "... Any luck...?" Skena hesitated, glancing back down to the sword. She seemed to consider the weapon for a few ever-so-slightly-drawn-out moments, before looking back up to Ludin with an apologetic smile and a little shrug. "... I think I need more practice. I'm not terribly surprised; it's my first time trying this kind of magic. Wasn't able to really pick up much." "Ah. That's fine. Not any worse off than I started there, I suppose," Ludin accepted easily, gaze wandering back out towards the rain. "...Thanks for the effort." Skena waited until he had fully looked away, before locking eyes with Kaleva, her expression changing into a brief but pointed look of wide-eyed horror. Then she drew in a more gentle inhale, schooling her composure back to the polite smile. "Of course. Maybe I'll try again later and see if I have better luck with a bit more study."
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:38 AM
Kaleva watched Skena intently, and at that look of horror, the wet hair on his neck and back bristled up, his lips pressing into a thin line. He looked at the sword as though he wanted to chuck it away from her immediately, and had to close his eyes and take a couple deep, steadying breaths to calm himself. Once he'd wrestled down the instinct to protect Skena from the thing that had frightened her, he opened his eyes and looked back at Ludin. "What was your friend like? The one who loaned you the sword?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:47 AM
Skena did not, at least, seemed concerned to be holding the weapon, though as she concluded her task, it was delicately set aside. Ludin seemed to miss the entirety of the wordless exchange between them, glancing back over to Kaleva at the question. "Ah... Saw a bit of myself in him, I suppose," he replied after a moment's thought. "Kind of aloof. Sometimes hard to get a read on 'em, but... we got along. Helped me out a bit. I tried to do the same for him. He was able to give me some work when I needed the coin. Lent me the sword to help keep me safe while I was doing it."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:18 AM
He hummed softly, his tail tip tapping lightly against his thigh. "What happened to him? If it's okay to ask."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:21 AM
Ludin shrugged a little. "Went to go find him after finishing the work. Couldn't. Eventually tracked down a mutual acquaintance, who told me he died. Somethin' about having enemies. Didn't know him well enough to have insight on that. He wasn't a tiefling or anything, just... good old fashioned havin' enemies, I suppose."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:41 AM
"It happens," Kaleva agreed with a shrug. "Blackswords?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:43 AM
Ludin shrugged again. "Don't know. Those lines were... kind of blurred at that time. Could have been. Could have not been, too." He was quiet a moment, before squinting slightly, glancing back over to Kaleva. "... Who did you say your neighbors were again?"
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:56 AM
A brow quirked at his squint, head tilting slightly to the side. "Hiraeth, Cass, Nils, Margret, and Stefan. The last two are humans in their nineties. Nils and Hiraeth are tieflings, and Cass is elven."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:58 AM
Ludin was quiet for a moment, seeming to process that to some extent without quite looking at Kaleva. "... You said something about... this employment of yours, finding aether crystals. Don't think you've told me much about that. Is it... like being a miner, then?"
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:03 AM
"No, it's more of traveling to different locations to ascertain if there are aether crystal nodes present, and to clear the area and make it safe for the miners to come in. Sometimes we'll get hired for other jobs too, but mostly it's to that end." Kaleva kept his tone and body language casual, keeping in mind the information he gave out. Nothing that Ludin couldn't figure out himself by asking around, he figured.
Daarka 4/5/2023 9:08 AM
"Huh." Another stretch of silence as he seemed to chew over his thoughts, squinting a little. "... That what you all were up to when you went north, then?"
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:19 AM
Kaleva shrugged at that. "Skena and I weren't part of that excursion." He took a moment to think about what would be safe to divulge. "They were looking into the Blackswords that had attacked us. Probably to determine whether or not it was a one off, or part of a bigger problem we had to worry about. There's a lot of money to be had in aether crystals." (edited)
Daarka 4/5/2023 9:27 AM
Yet another thoughtful pause. "... Everyone make it back okay, then? Dunno how... how dangerous those things usually are."
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:29 AM
"No casualties that I heard of," he said with a nod. "You mentioned you followed them back to this area, right?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 9:30 AM
Ludin didn't respond immediately, rubbing the back of his neck a little. "... Sounds bad when it's put like that. But suppose that's what it was, yeah."
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:36 AM
"I mean, if your intentions were what you said they were, that you followed them because you recognized the description of the lizardfolk that was also on the mission you heard my description from..." He shrugged again. "It makes sense."
Daarka 4/5/2023 9:39 AM
"Yeah." He drifted off, looking a little lost in thought. It took him a moment, before he seemed to drag his mind back to the present. "... That work. Sounds dangerous. You enjoy it?"
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:45 AM
"It's a good outlet." Kaleva looked out into the rain, his thumb absently running over the branding on the inside of his wrist. "I spent a few years in prison in a city further north from here. Arson, theft, vandalism. I was an angry kid, after I was run out of Cusai and separated from Skena. After I served my sentence... I wasn't doing well mentally. One of the members of my order found me, offered me a place with them, and a safe outlet for the violence and anger I still held so I wouldn't vent in ways that would get me in trouble."
Daarka 4/5/2023 9:50 AM
"That's good... I'm glad you had that," he murmured. "... Knew some folks who were imprisoned and just... not released again. Glad they let you out when your time was up." He was quiet a moment more, seeming to debate whether or not he wanted to continue. Ultimately, though, he did. "... Been on the inside myself. I get it."
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:55 AM
That came as no surprise to Kaleva, and also explained a lot, if Ludin's experiences were anything like his own. He looked back to him, expression softened a fraction in shared grief. "Were you ever like that? Angry and lashing out at the people and society that failed us? Or did I get the temper from my mother?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 10:01 AM
He drew in a deep breath, letting out a long, tired sigh. "... Never really had much of a temper myself, no. Way I figured... I already had my hands full trying to stay afloat without inviting more conflict. Easier to tell folks what they want to hear, have it over with sooner. For better or for worse." He was quiet a moment. "... Don't think you got it from your mother. Wouldn't have fit the woman I knew, anyways. It's... why I loved her. She seemed different, somehow, from all that evil up north. She... looked at me like she saw right through the glamour. And smiled at me anyways." A beat, before he shook his head a little. "Sounds stupid. Was stupid, I suppose."
Dakota 4/5/2023 10:15 AM
It was weird, hearing his mother described like that. But he supposed things hadn't quite worked out well for her either. She probably wound up dealing with a lot of shit for giving birth to a tiefling. "It's not stupid to want to be seen and loved." He glanced at Ludin, then away into the rain again. "I don't know whether or not you did the right thing by running away. I do believe you made the only choice your experiences had taught you that you could make. I can't say if her knowing what you were would have changed anything. All I know is that she wanted nothing to do with me. She had a friend that tried to do the right thing, came down into the cellar and taught me some things, gave me things to do, even though she was terrified of me. The most I saw of my mother was when she came down to give me food or change out my bucket or give me clothing when I'd grown out of what I'd been given. She could barely look at me most of the time." He heaved a sigh and reached up to rub the bridge of his nose, closing his eyes. "Maybe she's happier now."
Daarka 4/5/2023 3:56 PM
Ludin's gaze remained off at some distant point in the rainfall, something hollow and existentially tired in his face. "... Must've broken her heart," he mumbled, almost to himself, the words quietly haunted. He looked absolutely miserable as he processed that, coming to terms with what had been left in the wake of his flight. "... Seems I just ruin lives everywhere I go." A beat. "... I'm sorry you were born into that. You didn't ask for that. I was too careless." "Everyone present has known deep pains," Skena interjected, her words soft but firm. "But your role in creating Kaleva, flawed though it might have been, is not something you should be ashamed of. I would likely be dead without him in my life. If we all die tomorrow, his legacy is a beautiful one filled with love and peace. None of that should ever be implied to be a mistake."
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:10 PM
Kaleva turned his head slightly to look back toward Ludin, and after a moment he murmured quietly, "...You care. You cared enough to look for me. To track me down, to approach me and tell me who you are, while not having any idea of how I would respond. You care enough to stick around in a situation that is unknown and frightening, just for the chance to have a relationship with me. That's... It means something."
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:13 PM
Ludin briefly side-eyed him, quickly dropping his gaze again under the kind words. Doubt was still etched in his face, and it took him a long moment to find his words. "... Don't want you to... come to regret it, is all. I'm sure Marian does."
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:18 PM
"Whatever she feels, she probably thinks I'm dead. Marko told her and the villagers that I had fallen through the river ice and drowned, so they wouldn't keep looking for me." Leaning over, he picked up another log to toss it onto the fire with a spray of sparks and crackling pops. "I accidentally killed another child when I escaped from the basement. They would never have let me live if they'd found me."
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:21 PM
Ludin was silent for a while, probably digesting that. When he spoke again, the words were soft. "... I do care. Just... don't have a great track record with the things I care about. Feels like a matter of time before I find a way to stumble into ruining your life, too." A beat. "More than I've already done so, I suppose." (edited)
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:29 PM
"Maybe, but intention means a lot. I don't believe you ever meant for me to come to harm, or suffer. Marian either. You and your choices are the product of a world that left you very few options on what you had to do just to survive. And that's on them. All the people who taught you that you are devil spawn, that you are evil and rotten and unworthy of basic rights."
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:34 PM
"... Yeah." He didn't sound wholly convinced, but he at least he stopped fighting it. The silence stretched on for a bit, before Skena looked around with a gentle inhale. "... Rain doesn't look like it's planning on letting up any time soon. Maybe it's best we pack it up for the day?" She didn't say that she was also getting cold, but Kaleva knew her well enough to probably be able to guess that was also a contributing factor to her wanting to be home.
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:46 PM
Kaleva nodded. "Probably for the best. No point in getting soaked." He looked to Ludin then, head slightly tilted. "Are you staying and camping out here, or joining us back home?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:47 PM
Ludin glanced up briefly, before dropping his gaze and shaking his head again. "No, no, that's... that's alright. I'm fine to stay here." After a pause, he added, "Thank you for the meal."
Dakota 4/5/2023 7:51 PM
"Sure thing. See you in the morning, Ludin." He pushed himself to his feet and slung his bag across his shoulder, leaving Ludin to the shelter and the fire and the remaining cookies. Atreyu yawned and pushed himself to his feet, waiting patiently for his riders to mount up before taking them home, the huskies falling in line shortly after. Kaleva waited until they were back home and out of the rain before he spoke up. "...What did you find out about his sword?"
Daarka 4/5/2023 7:57 PM
Skena's chest felt like it was full of bees more and more as they approached home. She waited until they were fully shut away inside before letting out a long, tight, high-pitched noise of distress. "I... I don't think I've ever seen something so... That is the purest evil I think I have ever been that close to--" she stammered, tripping over herself as the overwhelmed horror she had been suppressing was given its appropriate time and place. "It--I--" She took a deep breath, raking her fingers through her hair. "... The signature I originally got on it makes a lot of sense now. I was right; the enchantment rarely comes into play. Using the sword normally, it's--it's just a sword. But if it deals the killing blow on a creature... the enchantment is that the creature's soul forfeits whatever afterlife it was destined towards, and is instead funneled into the River Styx. They are immediately and irrevocably damned to spawn as a lemure in the pits of hell. That's--That is the most bad necromancy I have ever heard of, I didn't even know that was a thing--"
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:04 PM
Kaleva boggled at her, his eyes widening. "What the fuck? That's..." He exhaled sharply, reaching up to rake his fingers back through his hair, turning and pacing restlessly as he thought. "We can't just... let a sword like that continue to exist. We need to tell Ludin. Maybe get him a replacement so we're not just stripping him of his weapon, but... That sword needs to be destroyed."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:08 PM
"I-I mean yes, but--The reason I didn't just tell him what it was is because I--I mean, we don't know how he'll respond? He seems like he'll be doing a disappearing act at the first sign of confrontation, I didn't want to spring that on him and make it sound like we consequentially are blaming him for it when--" She paused to take a breath. "I... I believe him when he says he doesn't know what the sword does. He was so unbothered by the idea of me discovering the enchantment, that it'd be insane for him to be that calm about it while knowing what I was going to discover. And I don't know what that means! I don't know who gave him the sword, I don't know if he was lying about that--all I feel confident about is that I know what the sword's enchantment does, and I feel confident Ludin doesn't know." (edited)
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:14 PM
He shook his head. "I agree, everything I've seen so far... Ludin's a coward, but he's not evil or malicious. I think if... like I said, if we have a replacement sword for him, something nice, that alone would be sign enough that we don't blame him. I'll..." He trailed off, then said more quietly, "I'll commission something for him, rather than just buy some stock off the shelves. So that way when we approach him about it, when we have that in hand to offer in exchange, something personal like that will come across far better, I think."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:18 PM
Skena couldn't help but smile a little, her gaze softening despite the stress. "... I think that's a really good idea. I can pitch in some gold for it, too." She shuffled forward, wrapping her arms around the tiefling and letting out a long sigh, trying to let the tension leave with it. "... I can't imagine him actually killing anyone in general, so as uncomfortable as it is to have that sword floating around, it probably stays sheathed all the time anyways. Especially down here, he's not gonna run into the kind of trouble that he'd have to draw it over. I'll start putting out my feelers for a good place to deliver the sword once we trade for it. Enchanted items--especially with enchantments that strong--aren't easily destroyed, and doing so is definitely over our pay grade. But Altaira might have connections."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:28 PM
"She might," he agreed. "Or Roots, too." He paused at the mention of roots, his arms wrapped around Skena, and he let out a long sigh. "I should go talk to her about Ludin. She'll want to know, particularly with his former ties to the Blackswords. Maybe she can give me some suggestions on how to gently interrogate him on things, or what's safe to divulge, or just... how to proceed in general."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:29 PM
"Yeah, maybe... Speaking of in general, how are you feeling?" Skena asked, turning her head against his chest to look up at him. "The--The sword thing is a lot, but outside of that... things with Ludin himself seem to be going okay."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:38 PM
"Yeah, I don't know... It's hard to figure out what to say sometimes. Neither of us are good conversationalists to begin with, and putting us together is just a lot of awkward silences and stilted words and self-flagellation on his part." He scritched his pointed nails lightly along her scalp, carding through the white strands, but staring off absently. "He's like a kicked puppy. Hopefully we'll be able to instill some sort of confidence in him soon... I'm half-tempted to sic Margret and Stefan on him, if I wasn't so sure he'd run screaming for the hills at the sight of a couple of unknown Holbrekkian humans."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:40 PM
Skena snorted, leaning into his touch. "Yeah, probably. But might be good to do eventually. We can tie him up so he can't run, and just has to endure having said couple accept and love on him." Her tone was clearly jest, but she did still seem to find value in the overall idea. "He's... probably like you, though, in that he needs to just... settle first. Create a new precedence of normality before crazier things can start being introduced."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:47 PM
Kaleva nodded, pressing a kiss to the top of her head before gently extracting himself. That sandwich earlier would normally have been plenty to fill him, but he still felt hunger gnawing at him, and went to scrounge for something else to snack on. "Maybe after we get the house finished and he's had a couple weeks to settle in. That should give him some time."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:48 PM
"Yeah." She trailed after him into the kitchen--not because she was hungry, as she very much was not, but simply to stay around him. "... Do you have a tapeworm or something?"
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:51 PM
"...A what? No, why?" He popped his head back up from the fridge, a steak wrapped in butcher's paper in hand as he went to light the stove.
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:52 PM
Skena snickered, hoisting herself up to sit on the countertop out of his way. "I dunno--you just ate. Usually you'd still be full by now." She shrugged. "You probably don't have a tapeworm, by the way, I'm mostly kidding."
Dakota 4/5/2023 8:56 PM
"Yeah, I must have worked up an appetite or something, I don't know. I'm still hungry." He shrugged and took down a skillet to set on the stove while it warmed up, unwrapping the steak and eyeballing it to see if he just wanted to cut off a portion, or... nah, fuck it. His stomach growled audibly as he leaned down to sniff at it, his mouth watering. "I'm going to need to go back out and give the huskies a wash too, and a good brush down after, they're blowing coat like crazy. Might do some hunting too."
Daarka 4/5/2023 8:58 PM
"Yeah--It's a good thing they don't want to come inside just yet in the season, or we'd have a mess everywhere. And I don't know prestidigitation." Anything noteworthy about his appetite was easily shrugged off. Boy was hungy, no big deal. "I can help with the grooming if you need an extra set of hands, though."
Dakota 4/5/2023 9:11 PM
"I'd appreciate that. I can tackle Song if you want to get Finch. He listens better to you."
Daarka 6/6/2023 8:17 PM
The forest around Kaleva was dark, but layered in the silvery light of a brilliantly full moon, that glow strong enough that even if he did not have eyes suited for darkness, he would have no trouble seeing in perfect clarity. He ran--not towards prey, and not in flight of anything pursuing him, but because the fire in his veins bade him do so. Everything under his skin surged with power, and long, wicked claws tore through the cold earth below. His earth. This was his forest. He was the god of everything in sight, everything he could smell. The stars glittering above--those were his. The crickets softly chirping, the gentle sounds of an owl--those were serenades in his honor. His fur dripped with the blood of those who had futilely and ever so briefly stood in his way, his pulse still drumming with the adrenaline of those conquests. Every leaping bound was a revelry of his own muscles. Even his physical stature was so much more than it had been in the past; his eye level was not that of a wolf, not that of his hybrid form, but something that held regally higher than any form he was typically accustomed to. This was right. This was how he deserved to live. How he was destined to live. The blood that soaked the ground around him and dripped from the trees themselves was right-- His thundering pace skidded to a halt as he abruptly found a figure blocking his path ahead. Teeth dripping with crimson ichor were barred at the shape--possibly humanoid, but so hard to discern features of. Their back was turned to Kaleva, and the indignance of his ferocious presence being ignored made his blood roar in his ears. The scent of old decay tickled his senses, coating his glistening nose and the surface of his red-stained tongue, and something about it spurred him into blind rage, driving him forward to close the distance between himself and this stranger, with every intention of severing their body in half with a snap of crushing jaws. "Kaleva... you're making weird noises, are you alright...?" The voice came from his left. His charge faltered again, head whipping to face the small voice. The small, familiar voice... and the small, familiar shape... she looked so out of place in these dark, bleeding woods... "Hey..." Clearer this time. A gentle touch at his shoulder.
Dakota 6/6/2023 8:26 PM
Kaleva's eyes snapped open, and he drew in a sharp breath through his nose, that rage still singing in his blood. Without even realizing it he jerked forward and snapped his teeth at Skena with a bestial roar in the back of his throat, the stripe of hair down his nape bristled up and standing on end. The sudden violence of the motion had the huskies launching out of bed like startled cats, and Atreyu reeling back so suddenly that he rolled completely off the bed to fall to the floor with a thump, long legs flailing as he squirmed to right himself.
Daarka 6/6/2023 8:39 PM
Skena had not been expecting the lunge, and was no match for him, even though he was scarcely all the way awake. She had been sitting on folded legs on his left side, and with no reason to expect he would awaken violently. And so Kaleva had no issues at all snapping his jaws shut around the side of her chin, teeth easily breaking her thin skin under the edge of her jaw and in sharp lines down the side of her mouth and cheek. She yelped in surprise and pain, jolting--but doing nothing to fight back as his weight effectively punched hers backwards, nearly reversing their positions. "--Ah--Kaleva...!" She choked in quiet shock, instinctively just wanting to wait for him to come to his senses and release her instead of resorting to self defense. The taste that flooded his mouth as her blood spilled was... right. He had sensed it just moments prior. And just as before, it filled him with a thrumming rage on some deep-seated, primal level--one he had always been aware of, but was not used to hearing express itself so loudly.
Avrae BOT 6/6/2023 8:48 PM
Kaleva makes a Wisdom Save!
DC 14 1d20 (15) + 1 = 16
Success!
Dakota 6/6/2023 8:54 PM
His mouth flooded with saliva, teeth and tongue now stained with her blood, and he was very nearly consumed by that rage, making an aborted motion toward her as if to press the attack. But then that rage in his eyes turned to realization, to horror, a second before he was suddenly slammed into and thrown away from Skena, hitting the wall and falling to the floor. Atreyu stood over Skena, legs braced on either side of her, shaking like a leaf but baring his teeth and growling deeply as he tried to protect her with his body. Dazed and bewildered, Kaleva slowly sat up, his hand over his mouth and his eyes gone wide. It felt like he'd had a bucket of icy water dumped on him, but he could still feel that rage simmering under his skin, that want to keep attacking, to bathe in her blood...
Daarka 6/6/2023 8:57 PM
Skena gasped as he was shoved away, reaching up and fumbling to place a hand over the top of Atreyu's muzzle as she clumsily sat herself back upright, eyes wide and face a bit blank with shock--and now colored with the unnaturally dark and dead-looking blood weeping from the gashes on the side of her chin and cheek. "... Th--That's alright, I'm... I'm okay, Atreyu. Good boy. It's okay. Let's... Let's all just take a deep breath," she murmured, the momentary spike of adrenaline being forcibly shoved back down in her chest. When she looked to Kaleva, it wasn't with apprehension or fear, but just... a very, very deep worry. "... Are you okay?"
Dakota 6/6/2023 9:05 PM
Was he okay? He kept his hand clamped tight over his mouth, like it was a shield between her and him, as if he could protect her by blocking his teeth from her physically. Atreyu lowered his lips back over his teeth but he remained very close to Skena, protectively shielding her. Song and Finch hovered nearby, tails tucked and ears flat, Song letting out low whimpers of distress. "...I'm sorry," he whispered against the back of his hand. "I'm... I'm so sorry... I... I never meant... never wanted to..." Roots. He had to go see Roots. Now. "I... You should probably..." He slowly pushed himself up, his charcoal skin ashen from the realization of what he'd done. "I'm not safe," he whispered.
Daarka 6/6/2023 9:09 PM
"H-Hang on, it's... It's fine, really," she insisted, golden light glowing as she regained her bearings enough to reach up and heal the (relatively minor) wounds. "I shouldn't have startled you like that, that's... that was really stupid of me, I just... you looked like you were having some sort of--of nightmare? Everyone's abrupt and strange when someone wakes them up from a nightmare, look, I'm fine," she continued, her brows knit with worry. "Are... I-If you still feel like eating me or whatever, I can do that spell, and it should take that away, and... I can go clean up to get rid of this blood, it'll be fine, Kaleva. It's okay."
Dakota 6/6/2023 9:13 PM
"It's not right," he whispered hoarsely. "It doesn't feel ri-- It felt right to hurt you. That's not right. I shouldn't be-- Something's wrong. I need to go see Roots. I can't... I don't trust myself around you. I don't want to hurt you again. Gods, Skena, I'm so sorry, I don't know why this is happening...." The taste of her was still in his mouth, on his lips. He quickly pushed up and went into the bathroom to run the faucet, to wash out the taste, though even that was done with a slight faltering, as though part of him resisted the motion to clean it away.
Daarka 6/6/2023 9:21 PM
"Well... Well, no, that's... not ideal," she relented slowly, carefully pushing herself to her feet (where she was mostly still able to comfortably stand between Atreyu's front legs without issue). "But that's... It's not like that's you, something's... clearly... happening," she continued, a bit haltingly. "But I'm... I'm not afraid of you, I know you didn't mean it. We can figure this out. If... If you want to go see Roots, I'm... I'm not trying to stop you or anything, just..." She winced a little, leaning back slightly so Atreyu's leg and chest was pressed against her back. "... Just... don't stay away? We'll... We'll figure this out. This is... This is still our home. Together. We'll figure it out together. If you... If you leave, just... come back, please..." Her voice had progressively gotten smaller and smaller. She had spoken with uncanny confidence and surety at first, despite what had just happened, but the insistence that he would need to isolate himself from her to avoid hurting her was what seemed to elicit more of a pained reaction than the bite had. The idea of him struggling with whatever he was going through and thinking he had to shut her out of it for her own good was... not what she wanted to happen. (edited)
Dakota 6/6/2023 9:31 PM
"...When it's safe." Kaleva wiped his hands and mouth dry once he'd rinsed away all of the taste of her, and he went to the closet to get dressed. "I don't know how long that will be, and honestly, I might not be allowed to come back here right away. But I'll come back when it's safe. I can't risk hurting you again, or worse. I..." He turned to her, still keeping a distance from her, his expression part way between starting to shut down and blankly horrified. "Whatever's going on with me, it wants to kill you, very badly. Nothing feels more right than that. I'm not risking it. You understand?"
Daarka 6/6/2023 9:40 PM
She wanted to protest. To keep trying to reassure him everything was going to be okay and it was okay for him to be around her--because she wanted him to be around her. Of course she did. But she at least respected him enough to truly let his words sink in, her jaw clenching a little. She couldn't argue that point. If she felt an urge to kill him like that, she'd remove herself from the equation, too. "... If you stay away for... I don't know. If you don't spend the night here tonight... will you..." she winced, "... write to me? Or... Or something? I... It's not that I don't think Roots is a good influence for you and all that, but... I just... We don't understand what's going on, and it's hurting you, and... the idea of not being there for you through it makes me sick. Not knowing how you're doing if things are getting this hairy is..." She paused, her lips pressing together tightly and jaw clenching again as she shut herself up. She was silent a moment, before drawing in as deep of a breath as she could manage. "... I'm... being selfish. I'm sorry. Do whatever you think you need to do. And just... let me know if there's anything I can do to help. You... You need to take care of yourself right now, and... if... me being involved complicates that, then you're right." She wasn't good at putting on a tough face under virtually any circumstances, and so even with how far away he was standing, it wasn't hard to see the tears welling up in her eyes despite herself. "... Just please hear me when I say I'm not upset with you. Okay? Do whatever you need to do, but... don't... don't beat yourself up about it. Please. Something else is going on, making you act out of character. That's not your heart, and I don't think for a second it might be. I'm not upset with you. I'm not afraid of you. I promise."
Dakota 6/6/2023 9:45 PM
"I know," he whispered, blinking back the tears that had started to gather in his eyes. "I... thank you. For understanding that. And I'm still sorry. You, uh... I'd... do that remove curse spell on yourself, just to be safe... If Roots thinks I should stay away from you for a while, I'll write. And if something happens that I can't write, I'll make sure Roots or someone from the Order keeps you updated on what's going on. I promise. I won't disappear on you again. Okay?"
Daarka 6/6/2023 9:47 PM
She hadn't even fully grasped in her own conscious mind how much that was exactly what she was abruptly afraid of until he put it into words, and she blinked rapidly as tears finally spilled, sniffling and nodding as she scuffed them away. "Okay. Okay. This will be alright, go do what you need to do. I'll take care of things here," she managed softly.
Dakota 6/6/2023 9:55 PM
"Okay," he breathed, and then looked to Atreyu, who was still eyeing him uncertainly. "You did good, Tre. You're such a good boy." The hound relaxed at that, and his tail thumped softly as he settled back down to lay on the bed. "Keep everyone safe until I get back, alright?" Atreyu boofed softly and rested his chin on his paws, and with a last (quietly scared) look at his little family, he pulled on his boots and tucked his amulet inside the neck of his tunic to feel it against his skin and headed out into the night. Normally, riding Atreyu would have made it a quick trip, or even transforming, but as much as that heat in his veins wanted him to transform, he didn't trust it. He didn't trust it not to... to turn back, to hurt someone, to lead him anywhere but where he was going, like it might know he was going to try to stop it. So he hoofed it on foot.
Daarka 6/6/2023 10:09 PM
Skena waited until he was gone, and then took several deep breaths to try to force calmness upon herself, before going to comfort the huskies and Atreyu both, working with the former especially until they weren't scared anymore, through lengthy stretches of attention and petting and cooing, to her grabbing some jerky and busying their mind with doing various tricks for enthusiastic praise. And when the dogs were all reasonably calmed and seemed reassured that all was well enough, she crawled back into bed, Gummy folded up against her chest like a teddy bear, and quietly sobbed to herself.
Dakota 6/6/2023 10:21 PM
It was midmorning by the time he reached the headquarters, nestled hidden in the hills, the entrance in which was under the roots of a massive tree and buried into the side of the ravine. Brushing aside the layers of hanging ivy, he used a claw-like nail to prick his thumb and trace a rune in blood on the door. Blood magic activated, the door unlocked and he pushed his way inside, closing it behind him and heading down the dimly-lit tunnel into the den-like sanctuary of the Order of the Lycan. The main room was a circular one, with a fire pit in the middle of the floor and a chimney leading up around it to vent the smoke out of the area. A few chairs, a couple tables, and scattered books gave it a more comfortable, homey look. Two of the Order's lycans that were 'on guard' were hanging out in the area, greeting Kaleva with familiarity, and at his grave request, one of them went off to fetch Roots and bring her to the main room while Kaleva folded his arms tightly and slumped against the wall.
10:21 PM
1
Daarka 6/6/2023 10:26 PM
Roots didn't keep him waiting long. Though when she did show up, she was not wearing her usual leather armors, but a far more casual robe of sorts, as if she had been roused from sleep. Further supporting this idea was the fact that she was barefoot, her hair loose and mildly tousled, and no weapons in sight. But then again, she was also in one of the safest places any of their Order could be--so while the presentation was a bit new, it wasn't terribly inconceivable. "Kaleva?" She greeted hesitantly, though one look at his face was enough to sense something was awry, and she gestured back the way she'd come with a tilt of her head as she finished tying off the sash of her undyed cotton robe. "... Come, you look like you need to talk. We can head back to my room for a bit of privacy."
Dakota 6/6/2023 10:38 PM
Kaleva simply nodded and went to follow her, his arms remaining folded tightly as he sort of hunched in on himself. He didn't speak until they were back in Roots' room, the tip of his tail flipping back and forth with suppressed agitation. "I need your help. Something has been happening to me, and it's been getting worse over the past few weeks. It started with just... increased energy and appetite, more instinctual behavior, like what usually happens around the full moon, but well in advance of it. A shorter temper, snapping at the dogs when they misbehave, going overboard on hunting behavior. I've even... I've been able to transform twice a day instead of just the once. And everything about it feels right. Like it's how it should be. And tonight I was having a dream, and Skena woke me up... and I bit her. And I almost kept attacking her after I regained my senses, because of how right it felt, that I should tear her to pieces and I should bathe in her blood and I..." He swallowed thickly. "She wasn't badly hurt and healed herself, and has the capability to remove the curse. But I'm no longer safe to be around. Not until we figure out what's happening and why. But before we proceed I need your word that if I'm unable to keep in contact with her, that you or someone else from the Order will, so that she's not left in the dark about what's going on. I disappeared from her life once. I'm not doing it again."
Daarka 6/6/2023 10:52 PM
Roots' room, despite her position in the pack, was humble and cozy. If Kaleva hadn't gathered as much before now, it was apparent that she as least partially lived in this space, given the king-sized bed and other bedroom-like furniture decorating the space, with animal furs liberally draped about and making the place look wonderfully snuggly, especially with how pleasantly dimly lit it was. She turned to face him as he spoke, blinking as she listened to all he had to say. When he concluded, she took a moment to slowly inhale, processing it all. "... Reason?" She called out after a moment, which was followed by a faint rustle from behind a draping curtain that sectioned off part of the room, possibly a bathroom space. "Yeahp, I'm leaving," came another female voice, sounding both apologetic and awkward, as the previously hidden figure slipped out from the space that had been concealing them, also in the process of finishing up tying off a robe of her own. It was a tiefling woman with a bronze-colored complexion, contrasted by pale hair and two pairs of dark horns that grew close to her skull, the uppermost pair curling around the crown of her head with the lower pair curling forward under her ears. She, much like Roots, had the appearance of someone who had just been roused from bed. But maybe there hadn't actually been any sleep involved.
10:52 PM
The tiefling lifted a hand in both apologetic appeasement and rushed greeting towards Kaleva, and she gave him a muted smile that looked like it would have been much more brazen and lopsided had she not just overheard what he'd said. "Apologies. Wasn't trying to be hidden, didn't realize Roots was coming back in here to talk." "I should have explained myself as we walked. That's on me," Roots said with a distracted sigh. "I'll talk to you in a bit, love." With a brief word of farewell, the tiefling slipped out of the door and closed it behind her, leaving them actually alone. "... First things first," Roots finally continued, "... Reason has a good heart. She won't repeat anything. That established... I appreciate you coming to me. Come, sit down, make yourself comfortable. You have my word that whatever we decide to do, I'll make sure your Skena isn't left in the dark." She also padded over to a chair pushed in to a desk against the wall, pulling the chair out and angling it to face him as she took a seat. "... I don't think anyone else in the pack has been having a similar experience. Did something... happen to you that might have triggered this?" She started, her words slow and measured as she thought through all the information that had been deposited in her lap.
Dakota 6/6/2023 11:01 PM
Kaleva blinked at Reason, his ashen complexion rather suddenly flushing with color as he realized what he interrupted, and mumbled an embarrassed apology to Reason as she departed, and gave an equally apologetic wince to Roots. He went to take a seat at her invitation, sitting forward with elbows propped on his knees, rubbing at the base of his horns. "No. Not that I can think of. No attacks or anything." He paused, then narrowed his eyes in a squint. "...My biological father showed up and we've been getting acquainted. He used to be affiliated with the Blackswords, but from his behavior and the way he spoke about them... He's a twitchy, anxious, cowardly type. Doesn't like the Blackswords, regrets having had anything to do with them, doesn't want to be part of them."
Daarka 6/6/2023 11:09 PM
Roots blinked at that, brows raising. "... Well. I can't immediately point a finger to that as causation, but that's... certainly a coincidence. A very specific one." Her gaze wandered off across the ceiling, head tipping in thought. "... So... It's been many moons since we had this discussion, but let me be sure I still have all the pieces. You are a descendant of Fenrir. A cult that worships Fenrir had two of its members attack you and your party last fall. I sent volunteers from the guild north to investigate in the winter, and this spring, your biological father shows up--who, by definition, would have to also be a descendent of Fenrir, unless something's going on in the family tree that can't be easily predicted--and after reuniting with him, you are... effectively becoming, for lack of an official term, borderline untamed. Am I misunderstanding any details?"
Dakota 6/6/2023 11:19 PM
He shook his head. "That's about the gist of it." There was a pause, as he clearly debated on whether or not to bring something to light. This wasn't something he felt was necessarily... dangerous to exclude, but it was something deeply personal. And he really tried not to be that guy that talked about the gods with others that didn't have similar or adjacent faiths. "...Anubis has appeared in my dreams, too. But to warn me. Not of anything specific, but He's been... apprehensive. And He's made it a point to remind me I have everything I need already."
Daarka 6/6/2023 11:47 PM
"Anubis? Interesting." Roots' gaze had been reduced to a contemplative squint as she processed the information. Silence stretched for a moment, before she spoke up again. "Well, then any thought that it's nothing to worry about is probably ill-founded, if your actual god is reaching out to try to ground you. Not that I would otherwise be inclined to say what you're describing is no big deal." She sighed, her amber gaze dropping back to him. "The urges you're explaining to me are the kind of thing I hear from people who haven't undergone taming. I'm... not entirely convinced you need to go through the taming again, I'm not saying I think you have been un-tamed--which would be a first for me to encounter, if you had. But..." She made a bit of a face. "Those lycans that attacked you in the fall. You told me they used hemocraft. So they, too, once went through the taming. And something managed to get them to a point where they... willfully undid that work. The taming isn't a cure, as you are well aware; it is an ongoing practice in willpower. You have never had issues with that prior to this, to my knowledge. Frankly, most of us don't, as long as we're at least moderately mindful of our wolves, and keeping them appropriately leashed. I... could be very mistaken about this, Kaleva, simply because I've never seen a case of what you're describing before. But my instinct is to diagnose it as your wolf... challenging you, I suppose. Something most of us do not ever have to deal with to this extent. But you're describing a power struggle that you haven't even been aware you were party to, which means every urge given in to is an inch the beast gains. I have no doubt the approaching full moon plays a role, as well; it will undoubtedly get more challenging before it eases up again." Her contemplative squinting had eased as she seemed to work out her thoughts on the subject, until she was leveling him with a relaxed and quietly confident gaze. "You succeeded in taming this beast once before. Perhaps yours, in particular, has been spurred into rebellion in the presence of more of your ancestral ties to a likeminded deity. In other words, Fenrir might be the fuel, and your curse is undoubtedly a spark willing to ignite upon contact. And if we are assuming my diagnosis is correct, then the cure is one you have conquered before, isn't it?" She dipped her chin a fraction, pointedly, towards Kaleva. "Whether or not you are safe to be around will come down to your ability to make your wolf submit." She paused, before drawing in a deep breath and exhaling slowly, leaning in to rest her elbows on her knees. "... Kaleva, if you need to be cured, and then bitten and tamed a second time, because you find this battle to be beyond your limits, I do not want you to hold out on making that call for the sake of pride. To be honest, we tell the newly inflicted that there's some stigma against those who are cured of the curse mostly to keep people from considering lycanthropy something they could don and doff willy-nilly. But what you're telling me is a circumstance where I believe it might be worth considering that as a serious option, should things not become more manageable. No one in this pack will judge you for that. You will still be one of us, and we will figure out what went wrong while you're in our ranks all the while, even without your curse, and then have you bitten again when you are more confident to take that back on. Of course, the taming is never easy, and doing it twice is not insignificant--but your words worry me. Wanting to bathe in your loved one's blood is not a small lapse in willpower. My guidance for you would be to first attempt to approach the issue as you did the taming itself, to make your sole focus the strengthening and upholding of your willpower and stability. But if that is a battle you are losing, it may be better to temporarily remove the danger so no one gets hurt, and try again when it may be safer." (edited)
Dakota 6/7/2023 8:03 PM
"...It's not about pride. I don't... have a lot of that, I don't think." He chewed over his thoughts, letting out a long sigh. "It's more that... getting lycanthropy, being able to change my shape, felt like I was finally... whole. Like I was who and what I was always supposed to be. Which makes sense if you consider I'm descended from Fenrir. I'll do it, if I have to. But I know it'll feel like I'm incomplete without it." Sitting back and tipping his head back to stare up toward the ceiling, he frowned in thought. "...What if I went through the Taming again, as I am now, instead of removing the curse and trying again later? It hasn't completely taken over, so some of the Taming is still in effect, so... it makes sense to me that that'd give me an edge, rather than wiping the slate clean and trying from scratch."
Daarka 6/7/2023 8:19 PM
Roots nodded in quiet understanding. "I don't seek to pressure you to pursue a cure if you have reservations. Your heritage may play a role in that... or it may not. Many of us find our other forms more familiar than the bodies we were born into. You are not alone in that." She sighed, leaning back again slowly. "Going through the taming again... hn. Perhaps it may be a solution, but I would be more comfortable exploring less intense remedies first. For most in our Order, the taming is undergone once. Prior to that, the lycanthropic beast in that individual is fully wild and unleashed. While your situation is concerning, of course, it doesn't read to me as you being untamed--though that may change if this is allowed to progress indefinitely. But the issue that poses is that your wolf is not fully unleashed at the moment. It evidently wants to be, but you are able to sit and speak to me like a civilized man right now in a way that tells me it's taking whatever little bits and pieces it can get, but it doesn't have full jurisdiction at the moment. To enter into the taming process anew... I would worry that would necessitate freeing it first. Otherwise, I struggle to see how you would be able to go through the process of conquering it again. And with what you are telling me, with how acutely strong it is right now..." Her gaze squinted ever so slightly towards the tiefling. "... If it getting its way could eradicate the tiefling Kaleva irrevocably, if something is going on that causes this force within you to be so unexpectedly powerful that the result of it getting what it wants would be the introduction of a formidable monster... Kaleva, none of us want that ending. There are some doors I'd prefer not to deliberately open without having exhausted all other alternatives first." Her eyes lidded slightly as she ran her fingers through her hair, quiet a moment in thought. "I think a better approach, for now, would be the mindfulness I mentioned. I believe that is, in effect, close enough to what you were intending to suggest; whatever bindings you still maintain over the beast remain, and you work to strengthen those that have come lose. I understand the urges, I understand the familiarity and wholeness you feel in that headspace. But it needs to be reined in, and that comes from putting it in its place. Much like a rowdy pet dog, who needs to learn that climbing onto the kitchen counter to steal food is unacceptable, no matter how much it is in that animal's nature. It will get table scraps--and you will indulge in the things that feel good and right--solely when Kaleva the tiefling grants that permission." A beat. "...
