Because if you cannot manage to win those power struggles when the beast is inherently half-subdued, then it does not bode well for how you would fare against it freed." (edited)
Daarka 6/14/2023 7:02 PM
Dakota 6/14/2023 7:13 PM
Jaska was... frankly, exhausted. Dark circles shone prominently beneath his eyes, and he was starting to pick up a distinct sickly-sweet smell of spoiled meat. It really had been unfortunate that this last mission had resulted in killing things that weren't alive and had no life force in them that he could siphon. Add in sleepless nights surrounded by strangers, one of whom he absolutely would stake bets on would try something with him if he slept... But he didn't want to go pick up Axa smelling the way he did, and so as the group split off, he made a side venture into Finders Keepers, giving weary greetings to Arsast ("Wow, you look and smell like shit!!" "I'm aware.") and to Ingrid before making his way to the enchanted door, knocking upon it.
Daarka 6/14/2023 7:18 PM
There was only a short pause following his knock, before the door--rather sharply flung open, as if the girl on the other side of it had been waiting to answer it on a hair trigger. The little aasimar standing there as the door was yanked open looked... a little bedraggled. Brows were preemptively knit, eyes a bit puffy and bruise-colored. And that expectant surge of adrenaline that had clearly shot through her in that moment just a heartbeat earlier bled out of her again as she recognized her guest. Not a look of disappointment, not a sagging of the shoulders that indicated Jaska was unpleasant to see at her doorstep. Just the very clear conclusion that he wasn't who she was evidently waiting for so tensely. Which meant it took her a second to remember how to greet him, and a second longer to remember how to try to smile. "Hey... sorry, I thought... um. Come in?" Her voice was small. (edited)
Dakota 6/14/2023 7:22 PM
...That was unexpected. Jaska blinked and stared at her for a long moment, taking in her demeanor and appearance, and then let out a sigh as he stepped inside. Walked right in, ignoring the dogs who had jumped up in excitement, and though Atreyu sank back down in front of the fireplace, the huskies crowded around him sniffing intently. "Oh, step off," he muttered as he shooed them away. "I'm aware I'm a little ripe." Thankfully the dogs were trained well enough that they left him alone then, though they circled nearby and kept lifting their snouts to scent the air, tails wagging. Jaska went to sink down into the couch, patting the seat next to him. "Tell me what's wrong."
Daarka 6/14/2023 7:24 PM
Skena shut the door behind him, helping shoo the huskies away and following him to the couch. "You're... Um. I take it the mission went okay? Do you need healing? That's what you came for, right?" She fussed, actually appreciating the momentary purpose it gave her as her gaze probed over his complexion searchingly, fingertips already glowing.
Dakota 6/14/2023 7:30 PM
"Mission went fine, other than dealing with insults and racist barbs from a particular teammate and babysitting Piper from making poor choices. And none of the things we fought had a scrap of life force in them. Also staying awake for several days in a row tends to fast-track my rate of decay. The potions you provided kept Cain and Niamh on their feet, so thank you again for that." He seemed to pick up that she needed the distraction from whatever was going on with her, and didn't fuss as she looked him over. He didn't seem to have taken much in the way of actual damage, his clothing fairly well intact with only minor blood stains.
Daarka 6/14/2023 7:35 PM
She did look genuinely relieved to hear the potions had been well spent. "I'm glad. I... I wish I could have helped out more, but it just... wasn't a good time..." she mumbled, trailing off and sucking in a deep breath, her hand lifting to direct her fingertips towards Jaska's heart. An instant later, the golden light seared through her, pouring warm, sweet vitality into the tiefling and leaving Skena's body marred and rapidly rotting in the wake of the magic. This time, she didn't manage to suffer it wholly silently, an involuntary grunt clawing out of her with the effort as she grit her teeth, slowly oozing down to sit on the floor and regain her bearings enough to start patching herself back up. "... I'm sorry someone was... racist..." she mumbled, sounding tired, but earnest.
Dakota 6/14/2023 7:42 PM
The vitality pouring into him had his eyes rolling back and fluttering shut, a ragged breath drawn in as he felt his skin tightening from its necrotic sag, the sickly pallor turning back to its normal ashy purple. When it had passed, he slumped back against the couch, dragging his eyes open to look down at Skena, reaching down to rest his hand atop her head. "I'm glad he did. He was being insufferable from the moment I met him, and taking whatever opportunity he could to try to verbally bring me down. Calling me a rat and the like. Probably due to some innate insecurity about his capabilities; the man was rather useless. But the moment 'inbred devil-spawn' left his lips, he gave me ammunition. He gave me power over him and his ability to find work with the Valehunters."
Daarka 6/14/2023 7:53 PM
She was too weary to even be shocked by what Jaska was repeating. Instead, she just sighed softly, running her glowing hand over a gangrenous patch on her arm. "... No one who says stuff like that even tries to be creative about it," she mumbled. "I told an entire coliseum of people that their hearts would find empty darkness for eternity in the jaws of Ammit. All anyone ever seems able to manage is devil-spawn. Maybe I should start liberally calling people human-spawn..."
Dakota 6/14/2023 8:00 PM
"Hmm. Maybe I should have corrected him that it's 'star-spawn'," Jaska mused idly, his fingers absently running through her hair in the same sort of absent affection he gave Axa. "Though I'm sure that would have resulted in a lot of questions that I didn't really feel like answering. Or would have even had answers for. Niamh seemed to have some history with him, though, which I'm very curious to find out more about. She swooped in on that pegasus of hers mid-battle and after the dust had settled, she held a blade to Meos' throat and demanded to know what he was doing there."
Daarka 6/14/2023 8:03 PM
"That's... very dramatic," Skena admitted distractedly, finally concluding her own healing and slumping against the side of the couch. She was silent and motionless for a while, before her (now slightly muffled) voice piped up again. "... If I make you food, will you stay here a bit?" She asked pathetically.
Dakota 6/14/2023 8:07 PM
A brow raised slightly. "Mm. Would you be opposed to me staying the night? I'd rather not go pick up Axa only to fall asleep on her for the next however long I'll need to recover."
Daarka 6/14/2023 8:12 PM
It was very, very helpful for Jaska that his sister had gotten in the habit of not informing Axa when her father was expected to be back, granting him exactly the kind of flexibility he'd need to make something like his current request possible. Otherwise, the little actual devil-spawn would probably commit literally unspeakable horrors with such a devastating change of plans. Changes can't cause tantrums if little devils never knew what the plan was in the first place. Instead of very genuinely raising (part of) hell, Axa would remain in abject misery and despair a little while longer. Still sad, but at least not threatening catastrophe. Skena's head jolted up a little in surprise, meeting his gaze again. "You--I-I mean, you don't--have to do that, I--I'm sure you want to go see your daughter, you've... been away so long..."
Dakota 6/14/2023 8:15 PM
"I do," he admitted. "But she'll want and need my attention, and I will not be able to give it to her to the degree she deserves if I'm falling asleep on my feet. And you seem rather in more need of company right now. Axa is safe and with someone I trust. She can bide a while longer."
Daarka 6/14/2023 8:26 PM
Skena stared at him a moment in silence, her brows worried and mouth just slightly parted. She wanted to protest, to be nice, to tell him no, have some extra restorative magic and go home and spend some time with your daughter before you crash. But the sudden idea of the house being empty again save for her and the dogs choked the words out of her throat. When the silence began to stretch on just a little too long, she closed her mouth, clenching her jaw momentarily and blinking a few times to fight back the tears that wanted to prickle up. "... What do you want for... something to eat? I'm..." She felt nauseous. Kaleva was the one who did the cooking. She didn't know nearly as much about making real food.
Dakota 6/14/2023 8:29 PM
Jaska watched her with a slight tilt of his head, considering once more her general state of everything. "Truth be told, I ate not long before arriving back in town. I might hit you up for some toast and honey later, if you don't mind. But right now I'm more concerned about what's the matter with you."
Daarka 6/14/2023 8:34 PM
She swallowed tightly at that, dropping her gaze from him to instead slowly look around the house, as if the answer was written on a wall somewhere. Kaleva went out all the time--how did it manage to feel so starkly empty this time? "... Um." She looked lost. Another uncomfortable moment passed, before she slowly picked herself up, at least enough to sit properly on the couch where Jaska had originally patted. "... Kaleva's just... been... having a rough time," she managed after a moment more. "... And I... I don't know how to help. I've... never not been able to at least be there for him before. Not since... I..." Another dry swallow. "I might be making things worse just by being around right now..."
Dakota 6/14/2023 8:42 PM
He blinked, settling back against the couch and crossing one leg over the other, arms stretched over the back of the couch, one behind Skena's shoulders, but not touching. "Did the two of you have a fight? Or is there something else going on?"
Daarka 6/14/2023 8:45 PM
She shook her head quickly. "No. No, I... don't think we've ever had a fight," she clarified, sniffling. "He... He's... going through... something neither of us understand. With the... the full moon and... his biological father showed up out of nowhere and something about it all is making him go--feral?? and when I woke him up this morning he bit me and then left to go talk to his Order." It was like picking a scab, rough and slow to yield results, and then all of the sudden, blood gushing everywhere. (edited)
Dakota 6/14/2023 9:48 PM
Jaska frowned at that, tipping his head back to stare at the ceiling. "...And his Order goes through a process to prevent that sort of thing from happening in the first place, correct? Do you think his father is doing something to cause it?"
Daarka 6/14/2023 9:51 PM
She sighed, slumping back against the couch. "We have no idea. His dad is so... mousy and... I mean, it's not nice, but the word we keep coming back to is cowardly. He just seems so flighty. It took him so much time to pluck up the courage to even approach us for the first time, that a couple days went by where we thought someone was stalking me. It's... It's wild to imagine him actually coming with malicious intent. And I've been... scrutinizing him for weeks now, because both Kaleva and I were watching for that kind of thing this whole time. Still are, really. We don't... fully trust him. But he's also given us no reason not to so far. But the... the timing is just... so coincidental..."
Dakota 6/15/2023 6:54 PM
He let out a low hum of thought, letting his eyes drift closed. "It is. Would you like me to have him looked into and watched? It's quite possible he could be acting under the influence of another, whether consciously or unconsciously."
Daarka 6/15/2023 6:56 PM
"... Maybe. I'm just... worried there's... not enough time..." she mumbled, her words quietly drifting off.
Dakota 6/15/2023 6:59 PM
Jaska tilted his head at that. "...What do you mean?"
Daarka 6/15/2023 7:07 PM
Skena was silent for a few seconds. "... The full moon is three nights away. Tonight being one of those. Kaleva's problems have just been ramping up... I just... I know the night of the full moon will be the worst. I... I don't know, I had been feeling like we could white-knuckle through it and then work on figuring out what had happened afterwards. Now, I just... can't shake the feeling that this is leading to something awful."
Dakota 6/15/2023 7:21 PM
"In that case... he's the best place he can be. For what little comfort that might bring." He tipped his hand to reach down and let his fingers run through Skena's hair, lightly toying with the pale strands. "Would you like Axa and myself to stay until the full moon is passed and things hopefully return to a semblance of normalcy?"
Daarka 6/15/2023 7:30 PM
She sighed softly. "... I don't object to that, but... I feel like Kaleva would oppose. He probably wouldn't want more people around that... he's worried about unintentionally hurting. And if he went after you, and that triggered Axa to go after him..." She gave a weak shrug, clearly not seeing it necessary to continue that hypothetical. They both knew how it'd end. "Besides... Kaleva might be self-conscious about it. He's always had things so well under control... and we aren't sure why that's not the case right now. The... The look on his face when he came back to his senses with my blood on his mouth was... I-I don't know, I don't want to humiliate him."
Dakota 6/15/2023 7:34 PM
He quirked a brow, opening an eye to look back at her. "Ah. I misunderstood, I had assumed he would be staying with the Order. Which - if it wasn't his intention, you might want to suggest. They would be best equipped to handle whatever might come."
Daarka 6/15/2023 7:36 PM
The look on her face made it seem like Jaska had scolded her, instead of him just innocently offering a simple, inoffensive opinion. She didn't respond immediately again. "... I don't want him to stay away. This... This is his home. This is our home..."
Dakota 6/16/2023 7:30 PM
"I didn't imagine you would. You miss him, that is understandable. He belongs here as much as you do." He dragged in a breath, exhaling slowly. "I've lost my temper in the presence of Axa before. Never toward her, but in her proximity. The violence I displayed deeply unsettled her. Perhaps even frightened her. And I'd never felt more like a monster than I did in that moment." Dragging his tongue over his teeth, he sucked on them briefly, then continued. "I had never felt ashamed to be the monster until that point, when I saw how she reacted to my display of unhinged violence. I needed to learn very quickly to keep it under control, to contain it until it was safe to do so, so that she would not be negatively affected. So I believe I have some idea of how Kaleva may be feeling. And were I in his shoes and I had lost myself and hurt someone I loved, I would want very much to make sure I had a handle on things before I trusted myself in her proximity again. For her sake and my own."
Daarka 6/16/2023 8:04 PM
Skena was quiet for a while, her gaze down into her lap as she turned his words over in her mind. He was right, of course. The logical, most precautious thing to do was for Kaleva to be in the Order's care at the moment. There was no getting around that. "... One time, I told you... really briefly... about some stuff from my past. I don't think I really... elaborated at all. I think... I told you Kaleva had lived with me in the temple. In Cautica. For a year. That... the man who raised me like his own daughter... I guess... he had a vision for me that didn't involve tieflings. Whether or not the tiefling made me happy was irrelevant. It... took me over a decade to realize that he must have been the cause of what ultimately happened. I... learned just enough, glimpsed just enough, to realize that in all likelihood... the man who was supposed to be to me what you truly are to Axa... had arranged to have my best friend framed for murder. And then executed." Her gaze wandered distractedly towards the dogs. Towards Atreyu: the embodiment of the moment their new lives were truly established. The symbol for having well and fully left the pain and fear in the past. For as smart as he was, he simply didn't know how he, just by existing, represented some of the deepest possible wounds finally being made right, as much as was possible. "... I bought Kaleva a puppy. He'd never had his own before, but he's always loved dogs. I'll never forget the look on his face when he registered that she belonged to him. That he got to own a dog of his own. He used to be so different... he's still such a beautiful person, but... he keeps to himself more these days than he used to. Back then... he was outgoing. Optimistic. Naïve, but... in all the best ways. I guess we both were. That light in him was so hell-bent on shining, despite everything he'd been through. It'd take many years more before it got subdued to where it is now... but... that day that I gave him Jasmine... that was the last time I ever saw it that bright. And nothing in the world could have possibly bothered me in the presence of that light." She drifted off, her gaze somewhere else entirely; another time, another place. "... He went out to buy supplies for her. He didn't come home. I got worried. I went to Oberon, I had no reason not to trust him. He brushed away my concerns, but they didn't go away. He assured me he'd send word out to track down where Kaleva went. Hours went by. It was taking too long. I felt... something cold in the back of my skull. I knew something was deeply wrong. I... I went to my room, and spent hours grinding through study until I had learned to send messages with magic for the first time; I've never learned a new spell so fast. When I made contact with Kaleva... he told me he'd been imprisoned. That the person responsible for magically ascertaining his honesty amidst accusations of murder... was lying about what they found. He was terrified. But there was so little the spell would let me say." She swallowed, pausing a moment, before continuing. "... I barely remember that night. I also... remember every single second of it. I don't know how to quantify it. Maybe it was prayer... or study, or... meditation. I just... remembered fire inside of me. Cautica judges the accused in a Trial of Faith, one on one combat against an appointed Arbiter. Arbiters are trained in gladitorial fighting from childhood. The concept is that the gods will protect the innocent from dying at their hands, and the guilty will fall. I guess everyone just happened to be guilty, in the end." A beat. "... Kaleva was not guilty. My god--my father--is the one who judges the hearts of men. And... I felt Him beside me all night. Not in consolation. He was ablaze with me."
8:04 PM
She squinted a little, then let out a small, short, humorless huff of breath. "... In the morning, when I tried my door, it was locked. I... I somehow forgot that detail for the next decade that followed. But... measures were taken to ensure I would stay out of the way. Measures I couldn't even fathom coming from those responsible. I broke out before first light. I went to the coliseum while the city was still waking up. I sat, and I waited. And when it was Kaleva's turn to... to die, to be reduced to a red smear on the sand by a sadistic minotaur, I gave them their divine intervention. I bathed the arena in holy fire. I nearly burnt myself to death in the process." She hesitated, before slowly shifting her position, angling her torso so her back was turned towards Jaska, and then carefully shrugging her top down to expose her back to him. The network of gnarled, ugly scars was unexpectedly shocking in comparison to the rest of her relatively normal complexion and apparent lack of chronic injuries. "I came so close to killing him. I don't know how close he came to killing me. But when he brought his hammer down on me, it shattered on impact. I've... I've never known that kind of rage," she continued quietly, softly readjusting her clothes back into place and leaning back once more. "It was my own, but... also the fury of a god. The fight didn't stop because I hesitated in some killing blow; Oberon just realized I was in the arena, and intervened so his... little crown jewel didn't get destroyed. He negotiated with the Overseer and reduced Kaleva's sentence to exile instead. I didn't see him again for ten years. He couldn't even take his new puppy with him." Silence stretched on. Then her gaze finally dragged itself over to Jaska's face for the first time in her entire story. "... I understand you know how Kaleva feels right now, as much as you're able. But now, do you understand how I feel?" She asked, her words barely more than a whisper. "Do you understand why the idea of him facing whatever this is by himself makes me sick? Do you understand why it's something we have to figure out how to fight together?"
Dakota 6/16/2023 8:14 PM
Jaska sat by and listened silently while she spoke, his gaze shifting to her scarring when she showed it to him. After she had finished, he was quiet for a long moment. Then he tilted his head slightly. "Do you know where his Order is located?"
Daarka 6/16/2023 8:35 PM
Skena's demenaor was pitiful and meek, but she gave a small nod, waiting to see where he was going with his thought.
Dakota 6/16/2023 8:42 PM
"Then, do you need someone to take care of your dogs and your home while you go to the Order to see how you can help him?"
Daarka 6/16/2023 8:44 PM
She stared at him for a moment, the gravity of his implied gesture slowly sinking deep, deep into her heart. Before she had found words, a few tears finally spilled free, and she blinked, sniffling. "... You hate dogs. I... It's a den of werewolves, I... I could probably bring them..." she stammered quietly, reluctant to accept what she presumed was his offer.
Dakota 6/16/2023 8:49 PM
"Yours are tolerably obedient. As long as you don't mind my bringing Axa here until you and Kaleva return, I can just have Luka bring her here while you pack a bag. I'll hold down the fort until you return. And probably have Luka linger long enough to make sure Axa stays out of trouble while I sleep." He dipped his hand down to give her shoulder a light nudge. "Agreed?"
Daarka 6/16/2023 8:52 PM
The tears didn't stop as Jaska doubled down. Not only was he willing to watch their dogs, which he disliked on principle, but he was willing to arrange to sleep in her home with Luka watching his daughter in the same space. And dogs. She was rapidly losing count of the things he was offering to do for her that were starkly contradictory to his preferences, solely in an effort to be nice to her. It took her more than a few seconds to find her words. "... I-I should... s-send a message to his... his Order first... I d-don't even know if they'll... want me to be there..."
Dakota 6/16/2023 8:57 PM
He nodded primly to her, as though this were a simple business transaction. "Do so, and I'll reach out to Valentine and see where Luka is at." He ran his thumb over the ring he always wore - which was now accompanied by a ring on the finger next to it, a new addition that looked like something that might have been shaped by Skena's hands, bone white with little skull-like faces.
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:00 PM
'Yes, dear? You make it back?' Skena sniffled again, nodding slowly as her keen eye caught his subtle gesture that she had come to recognize for more or less what it was. But she did as instructed, falling silent as she tried to settle her emotions enough so as to not sound as pathetic as she was in Roots' mind, her fingers carving a practiced arcane symbol through the air.
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:02 PM
'Yes. Took a pit stop to Skena's for a touch-up, none of the things we fought had any life force. Where's Luka at?'
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:03 PM
'He's here with me; I tend to keep him close most of the time you're gone. Sometimes the little one is unpredictable, but she's currently just harmlessly resigned herself to death. Why, is he in trouble?'
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:06 PM
'No, I'm recruiting him for a job, if Skena gets the okay. Apparently Kaleva's been having some trouble keeping his wild side in check, so he's gone to his Order to wrangle it. Skena is distressed by not being there to help him, some trauma from their history there. I said I'd look after her place so she could go be there with him, but I desperately need sleep, so Luka can bring Axa here and watch her while I get some shut-eye.'
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:08 PM
Valentine, of course, noticed the same things Skena had. And with that came an innate understanding of how important it was for him to support the aasimar in this moment; and so, of course, that meant there was nothing Valentine wouldn't do to facilitate it. `Oh, certainly. I'll round up him and Axa and head over, he doesn't work his parlor tomorrow and I had the day off from the tavern myself, so that's quite serendipitous. Between the two of us, we should be able to help juggle the little one and the dogs so you can recover.'
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:13 PM
'Oh, you're coming too? Very well, I'll let you know in a moment whether or not she gets the go-ahead.' He raised his arms over his head to stretch, spine crackling and yawning widely, then slumped back into the couch. "Looks like you'll have the entirety of the Pitovich family looking after things if you need. Neither of them have work tomorrow."
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:18 PM
About the time it took Jaska to conclude his messages was more or less the amount of time Skena needed herself, and she blinked back to the present a few times, face still wet with tears. "... She said he's... having a lot of difficulty," she whispered softly, sounding... somehow, even smaller than usual. Especially after the insight she had just laid out to Jaska, her tiny voice and curled in posture just read as... someone who didn't even know how to protect her soulmate from what was threatening him. Even if she could pull another coliseum-esque transformation out of thin air... she had nothing to direct that ferocity at. She couldn't help. But she could make things worse, it seemed. She stalled in that silence a moment, before swallowing and continuing. "... She... didn't think it'd be... a good idea for me to come tonight. She said to check in again tomorrow. That she'd be working with him the whole time to try to get him home to me..." (edited)
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:21 PM
Jaska reached into a pocket to pull out a neatly-folded square of cloth, offering the handkerchief over for her tear-streaked face. "Then I'll keep you company until then. Do you want the others too, or would that be too overwhelming?"
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:23 PM
The handkerchief somehow only functioned to further open the floodgates, and more tears were spilling before it had even touched her face. "P-Please let them come over... so you can see your daughter," she mewled. "You're... You're doing so much, I..."
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:29 PM
"Hush." He curled his fingers around the back of her head and drew her in to press his lips briefly to her forehead, then sat back again. "Don't make a big deal out of it. Now, dry your tears, take a deep breath. It's not so dire as it was before. You are both in good hands. You'll get through this." After signaling Valentine on the ring again, he sent to her, 'Slight change. Bring everyone over, but we'll be keeping her company until she is allowed to go see him.'
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:32 PM
Luka would see what Jaska did not: the absolutely endeared look that warmed Val's face at her younger brother's words. 'We'll be over soon. Do you need anything brought along for you? Food? Liquor? Change of clothes?' Skena fought to take a deep breath, though it came in shuddering quakes. Leaning forward, she wrapped her arms around him, burying her face in his chest and just... sitting like that for a moment.
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:36 PM
'Change of clothes will be fine. See you soon.' Jaska blinked, but either he was too tired to really tense up about it, or perhaps he simply couldn't see Skena as a threat, he let his arms settle around her in return, one hand behind her shoulders, the other cradling the back of her head. "You're alright, girl," he murmured. "And he will be too. You'll see."
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:38 PM
She didn't expect the gentle physical affection to help as much as it did. Her quaking sobs gentled steadily to just a silent stream of tears. After a few moments of regaining her composure (marginally), her voice faintly rose again from against his chest. "... You're a lot like Kaleva, you know," she murmured, barely any volume behind her words.
Dakota 6/16/2023 9:43 PM
"Mm. High praise," he remarked without sarcasm, but maybe with a slight jest to it. He knew how much Skena valued Kaleva, and to be compared to someone she held in such high regard, it honestly was high praise.
Daarka 6/16/2023 9:52 PM
"It is," she murmured, finally withdrawing again and gently untangling herself from him. She at least knew cuddles weren't really one of his favorite things to do, and didn't want to push his comfort. Especially with how much he was pushing it on his own for her sake. "You have... so much more of a capacity for goodness than... I think you give yourself credit for." She tiredly waved a dismissive hand. "I know there's drugs. And murder. And literal hell and stuff. But... everyone is shades of grey. No one is all good, or all bad. I think... you did the same thing Kaleva did. Where you just... became the thing the world was already categorizing you as. But... just like Kaleva... I don't think that defines you. I'm... All I've done is show you basic kindness. Compassion. Empathy. I've judged your actions instead of your labels. I've given you the benefit of the doubt instead of assuming you would do something worse. Those are... Those are things everyone deserves. I'm not some saint, I'm just... trying to do the bare minimum. I... I think the world would be... cured of everything wrong with it if everyone just... tried to do the bare minimum, too. Then people like you and Kaleva wouldn't have to experience the things you've experienced. You wouldn't have a lifetime of negativity and pain suppressing down the goodness inside of you." She gave a meek little shrug. "... World peace isn't... exactly realistic, though. But I'm... I'm really honored to be able to just... be a person in your life who can try to offer you that... basic decency you deserve. Thank you for... for trusting me."
Dakota 6/29/2023 9:52 PM
Jaska let out a little snort. "I never know quite how to respond when you get like this. Goodness and world peace and the like all seem like such naïve little fantasies. Things for fairy tales and sheltered idealists." He settled back as she let him reclaim his space, rolling his neck on his shoulders and massaging at his nape. "In any event, you've earned that trust and loyalty..." He trailed off as Song wandered back over and proceeded to sit on his feet with her back to his legs, her head tilted back to look at him upside-down. His brow furrowed at her, and he nudged her with one of his legs. "Oh, get off. What do you want? I'm not going to pet you." "Oh, woo woo," Song replied, rather sassily.
Daarka 6/29/2023 9:56 PM
Skena's gaze shifted to the goofy animal, exhaling faintly. "... She's a daddy's girl. I'm sure she misses Kaleva. He... He leaves, of course... but many times, he takes them with him." She was quiet a moment. "... I'm sure, if.... if this goes on longer... they'll get more pathetic." Leaning forward, she took Song's cheeks in her hands and gave her face a gentle rub. "Jaska doesn't like you," she informed her softly.
Dakota 6/29/2023 10:09 PM
Song let out a very deep huff, tossing her head up out of Skena's hands and vocally replying with a series of woos and prancing paws that he clearly should like her because she is adorable and charismatic and the bestest of girls, and swung her butt around to knock it against Jaska's knees for scritches. The tiefling, for his part, looked at her with the sort of bewildered amusement of one who hadn't ever really been exposed to Husky Antics before. "And I thought Piper's beast was strange. What is the attraction? They're needy and they leave their hair everywhere, they're loud, dirty... Luka's feline is only marginally more tolerable, except the whole litterbox business."
Daarka 6/29/2023 10:25 PM
"Song, baby," she said with a sniffle, though her gaze had softened in amusement, "If you push him, he'll eat you. Skin you like a rabbit, put you in the oven, and eat you dead. He doesn't like the song of your people." Still, she reached to rub her butt in substitute for Jaska. "... In a weird way... maybe it's a little like your relationship with Axa," she mused after a thoughtful moment. "They give you unconditional love. They have unique little personalities, antics, likes and dislikes. You learn how they communicate, even though its very different from how we express ourselves, and they learn how to interpret your words and behavior. Even the huskies, who don't have Atreyu's understanding of common, learn what certain words mean. T-R-E-A-T, for instance--they can't spell, of course--they know exactly what that means, and they start losing their tiny minds about it. Of course, they learn commands the same way. And before you know it... you're able to manage a sort of... unconventional back and forth with them. They're nothing like a whole child, certainly not like a devil child... but there are parallels, I think. Especially for your circumstances, where Axa is so largely nonvocal. And common isn't her mother tongue. There was a period where you both had to figure out how to communicate with one another, too, in unconventional ways. She relied on you to meet her needs, and even though it exhausted you and tested you in ways previously inconceivable... you protected her and provided for her. And somewhere along the way, mutual, unconditional love blossomed." A beat. "... Less shedding on your end, though."
Dakota 6/29/2023 10:34 PM
The snort Jaska let out that time was louder, more amused as he watched Song arch up into the scritches and wiggle herself up to Skena instead. Finch, quietly jealous that he was to see her snuggling up to his mommy, padded over and sat, reaching out to put a paw on Skena's knee, looking quite sad and tragic about the whole situation. "I suppose I can appreciate the loyalty they're known for. Still, I'll leave such creatures for you, Kaleva, and Piper."
Daarka 6/29/2023 10:51 PM
Skena smiled at Finch, freeing her other hand to rub his ears. "Pets aren't for everyone. But... I think it's nice, for many... to have unconditional love from such an innocent creature. They don't have our intelligence... though Atreyu is very clever. They don't know enough about life to be corrupt or vile. I think it... makes their love feel purer. Simpler, but purer. And many folks just... relate better to animals than people. I certainly don't have to tell you how awful the latter can be. In contrast, that simple, pure, unconditional love is an appealing alternative." She shrugged a little. "... Kaleva's early years were horrible. His birth mother locked him in a basement for the first twelve years. Horrified of having birthed a tiefling, but not capable of... putting him down, I guess. No contact to the outside world, barely any socialization at all. He was half as feral as Axa originally was. When he escaped, it was... through traumatic events. He still wears the scar on his face. The first truly kind gesture he ever really received... was from a dog. Who found him in the middle of the Holbrekkan woods, and kept him warm throughout the night."
Dakota 6/29/2023 11:04 PM
"And the first true friend he made is the daughter of a god with a dog's head," Jaska mused. "He does have a type." It wasn't terribly long after that, there was a knock at the magical door announcing the arrival of the rest of the Piotovich's. Along with an overnight bag for everyone, Luka also carried a plate of butterscotch cookies with brown butter frosting he'd made the previous day and had clearly felt needed to be shared.
Daarka 6/29/2023 11:10 PM
Skena nodded sagely. "Well--Jackal. Or a Cusan wolf; the temple doesn't have a clear answer for if Anubis has the head of a literal jackal, or if we call it a jackal and it's actually not scientifically meant to be a jackal... He certainly doesn't resemble any mortal canine I've ever seen..." As soon as the door was opened, Axa zipped across the room and planted herself back in Jaska's lap, giving out a small, heavy exhale, as if the brief separation had been exceptionally difficult. Skena, still at the door, beckoned Luka and Val inside. She knew a smile was relatively wasted on Val, but she wore a soft one anyways, especially at the sight of the cookies Luka carried, and the kind gesture it demonstrated. "Come make yourselves comfortable... I un-stinked your brother," she offered meekly.
Dakota 6/29/2023 11:16 PM
"Bit of a feat, that," Luka replied with gentle humor, his buttery soft eyes twinkling. "He's a little stinker by nature." "Cease," Jaska said drolly, cradling Axa to his chest and pressing a kiss to her temple. The dogs skittered away from Axa but gladly crowded around to greet the other two with wagging tails and sniffing noses. Atreyu remained laying in front of the fire, though, head on his paws and being quietly miserable. Snickering softly, Luka murmured, "I'll take these into the kitchen." On the way, he set the bag next to Jaska. "Clean clothes are in there, as well as night clothes for you and Axa. I figure she's quite likely to drop off with you. Skena, is there anything you'd like help with while we're holding down the fort?"
Daarka 6/29/2023 11:24 PM
Skena shuffled after Luka, looking at him and his cookies with puffy, bruise-colored eyes and an expression of deep humility in the face of his kindness, and that which Jaska had demonstrated on top of that. "... Um. We, um... We don't have a... a lot of places for guests to sleep," she managed, sounding horribly apologetic. "But I can sleep out here with Atreyu, and... Jaska, you can take the bed--and the wash room is in there where you can change and everything. You're welcome to the bath, as well. And, um. Luka, you can take the couch? My, um. My understanding is that Val doesn't sleep..." she continued, glancing to the woman questioningly. Val had helped herself inside, heading over to the sound of Jaska's voice and finding her way onto the opposite end of the couch with him. She cast a warm smile towards Skena. "That's correct, dear. I need no accommodations on that front." "That's... good, I don't think we really... have a good third option. Um... I'll... I'll write a note tomorrow to leave here with what the dogs eat, in case I end up gone particularly long... assuming they even let me go tomorrow. But... Atreyu understands common, and you can request his help in managing the other two. Song is the black one, Finch is brown. Sometimes they start up a cacophony, but they're pretty good about packing it up if you tell them to quiet. If they paw at the back door, they want to go out, but Atreyu usually lets all of them in and out as needed. Sometimes you just have to remind him to close the door behind him, he forgets..." Her gaze wandered to the massive, moping animal, and after a pause, she shuffled over to him, dropping to her knees to lean down and plant a kiss on his forehead, murmuring softly, "You didn't do anything wrong. You did everything right, actually. Everything will go back to normal before you know it, okay?"
Dakota 6/30/2023 9:26 PM
Atreyu let out a thin, pathetic little whine in the back of his throat as he gazed up at Skena, though his tail gave the feeblest of wags to let her know he appreciated the reassurance. He was still just a Very Sad Boy. "No worries, I brought my sleeping bag," Luka said from the kitchen. "And with Atreyu's help, I'm sure taking care of things around here will be no issue whatsoever."
Daarka 6/30/2023 9:30 PM
"Yeah..." Skena rubbed Atreyu's ears a moment longer, knowing that unfortunately, he was too smart to be easily reassured with pleasant words. He had a sort of object permanence that the other dogs didn't, and he knew what had happened had further-reaching implications. Unlike most dogs, he could worry about the future, and the wellbeing of a loved one out of sight. Sighing softly, she pushed back to her feet, looking over towards Luka and Val again. "... Thank you for coming," she squeaked. "Please just... genuinely help yourself to anything and everything." About an hour of relative peace passed, with simple chatter and indulgence in cookies and milk, opportunities for Jaska and Axa to change into sleepwear for their comfort, dinner for the dogs, and catching Luka primarily (and an eavesdropping Val) up on what was going on, more or less in similar words as it had been explained to Jaska. The evening was winding down--more rapidly for some than others--when the dogs would be the first to notice the approach of someone from outside.
Dakota 7/1/2023 8:56 PM
Jaska had taken opportunity to freshen up and change into the maroon pajamas, and had also gotten Axa cleaned up and dressed for bed. They were enjoying a warm cup of milk and honey (with cocoa powder mixed in Axa's) and about to turn in when Atreyu lifted his head and both huskies shot up from their lounging spots to start howling and yelling at the door, tails wagging. Atreyu's lack of enthusiastic response was telling in that it was someone familiar, but also not Kaleva. Luka blinked at the dogs and looked to Skena. "It's getting a little late for visitors, isn't it?"
Daarka 7/1/2023 9:06 PM
Skena would have shot out the door, had it not been for Atreyu's apathy. Which meant one of very, very few things, and none of them were either Kaleva or individuals from his Order. Probably. She set down her own honeyed drink of milk, getting to her feet. "... Some visitors of ours lean more nocturnal," she murmured, heading over to the door and pulling it open. Only to step back again to clear the threshold for said guest to enter, murmuring a soft, "Come on in, make yourself comfortable..." Followed a bit more awkwardly with, "... Kaleva's not home tonight, though..." The figure that (even more awkwardly) slipped inside was an unfamiliar face for all Piotovichs; ash-grey skin, salt and pepper hair that looked to have once been black, but had been streaked in silver with age, vibrant blue eyes... but cauterized, circular scars on his forehead where horns should have grown from, and no tail in sight. He carried a bundle and was dressed... not too poorly, but evidently like someone who lived off the land more than they visited towns. He only took a step inside before clocking the other guests, hesitating. "... I didn't mean to... intrude on your evening..." "You aren't," Skena murmured reassuringly, closing the door behind him before he could flee. "We weren't up to anything in particular. Just relaxing before bed. These are all friends of ours. Piotovichs, this is Ludin, and Ludin, this is Valentine, Luka, Jaska, and Jaska's daughter Axa. The former are triplets, if that wasn't obvious." (edited)
Dakota 7/1/2023 10:11 PM
It was a regular tiefling party at Skena's. One tiefling was temporarily displaced, so she received four and a Pretender to tide her over. Jaska looked over Ludin with wary caution overlayed by being near ready to drop off - though his innate paranoia gave him a nice dose of adrenaline to combat the warm milk. Luka, naturally, greeted Ludin with a warm and welcoming smile, stepping forward to offer his hand to shake. "It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Ludin. I don't believe I've seen you around town?"
Daarka 7/1/2023 10:24 PM
Ludin stiffly looked between the new faces a moment, looking like he was internally screaming in a viscerally introverted sort of way. He remembered himself a moment later as Luka's hand extended towards him, and he awkwardly shuffled what he was carrying to one arm so he could slowly return the gesture. "Ah. No," he replied slowly. "No, I... I don't go in town." "You want something to drink?" Skena offered, seeming completely used to his demeanor by now as she turned to head towards the kitchen. "... Sure. Thank you..." Ludin shuffled a couple more aimless steps inward, seeming to get tangled in his thoughts a moment. "... Sorry, I... The new faces... caught me off guard. What... were the names, again?" He spoke up (with a bit of effort) after a moment. Skena paused in her movement, pivoting back to face him. "Oh, no problem. Luka, Jaska, Valentine, Axa," she repeated, pointing to each of them. "Ah." He stared at a random spot on the floor for a second or two longer than was comfortable, before clearing his throat. "Pleasure. To... meet you all," he managed, making somewhat of an attempt to look at them all, but failing to properly meet any gazes. From where she sat on the couch, Valentine gave a warm smile his way. "You as well, Ludin. You truly are not intruding. Always a delight to encounter new faces." Jaska was near enough to her to see a very subtle gesture that Ludin certainly wasn't looking in the direction of enough to catch. Just a small, well-disguised somatic gesture that he had come to be familiar with from his sister, as what typically prefaced her eavesdropping into someone's surface thoughts.
Dakota 7/8/2023 5:57 PM
"Truly," Luka said warmly, patting Ludin's hand before releasing it. While Jaska made no pretense against examining his cauterized hornbeds and his lack of a tail, Luka took him in and accepted immediately everything about him, without question. "I brought a batch of cookies, and you are welcome to them as well." "You 'don't go into town,' you said," Jaska spoke up, his tail flicking slightly. "Any particular reason?" Clicking his tongue, Luka waved at him. "Oh, let him be, Jaska. It's not our business." Despite the fact that he, too, wanted to know, but his desire to be comforting to the man's nervousness won out over that.
Daarka 7/8/2023 6:12 PM
Ludin‚Äôs jaw clenched a little, before loosening again so he could reply, his words just as stiff as his posture. ‚Äú‚Ä¶ Doesn‚Äôt feel right.‚Äù A pause. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm from Holbrook. Killed on sight up there. Old habits now‚Ä¶‚Äù
Dakota 7/8/2023 6:19 PM
"Hm." Jaska's brow arched in silent judgement, but he offered up no further questions as he finished his drink and set the glass aside. Trusting that Valentine would fill him in on anything noteworthy, he gathered Axa up and said to Skena, "We're turning in for the night. Try not to party too loudly." "Goodnight, you two," Luka said with a bit of a sigh. "Rest well." Once the bedroom door had closed, Luka turned a wincing smile to Ludin. "Please forgive my brother, he's a cranky and suspicious person when he's not sleep-deprived."
Daarka 7/8/2023 6:29 PM
Ludin slowly shook his head a little, looking distracted and still not looking anyone in the eyes. "... I've earned some suspicion. I don't... take it personally..." He looked over as Skena returned with a mug of warm tea for him, of a blend she'd figured out that he liked. "Oh. Ah. Thanks." He reached to take the mug, staring down into it for a moment, readjusting what he was carrying to free the hand for it. "What all did you bring?" Skena wondered gently, half gesturing and half steering him towards the couch that Jaska had vacated. Ludin needed the urging, she'd learned, or else he'd just stay standing the entire time. "Ah... Furs," he admitted haltingly. "I... I didn't know what else to... I'm sure you don't even need things like that, but..." "We can always use good materials," Skena reassured gently. "Thank you. That's really sweet of you. You know you don't owe us anything, right?" Ludin did not look like he knew that, but he gave a slow, still distracted nod anyways. "'Course. Just. Just felt like I... should..." His attention slowly shifted towards Valentine, who still sat comfortably at the other end of the couch, contentedly listening along with lidded eyes. After a moment, sightless though she was, she seemed to become aware of his gaze, and a slight smile warmed her features. Something about it almost seemed to make Ludin uncomfortable enough to look away again. His attention shifted to Luka next. "... Ah. You... You lot've known Kaleva a while, then...?"
Dakota 7/8/2023 6:37 PM
"Mhmm, a couple of years now, I think? Or close to it." Luka sat down on the floor in front of Valentine, resting his back against her legs. "We met him through Skena. He's a bit shy about being in town too. More confident now than he used to be, but at first he was pretty withdrawn. Out here is where he really shines, though." He glanced over as Finch went to paw at the door, but before he could get back up to go let him out, Atreyu heaved himself to his feet and walked over to mouth open the door for him, and he and Song headed out into the much cooler night, since all these guests were just going to sit around and make mouth sounds that they weren't allowed to participate in. Atreyu pawed the door closed once they left and went to lay back down in front of the fire again, head on his paws.
Daarka 7/8/2023 7:02 PM
Val's tail tip curled over Luka's elbow as he settled against her, and her hand moved to run fingers idly through the soft curls of his hair as she listened along. To many different things, the vocal conversation only being one of them. She was a nosy barkeep; she was well experienced with shutting up and listening, and letting those who were speaking all but forget they were being overheard. A little harder to accomplish in this arrangement, though, and Ludin certainly wasn't fully relaxing, even as the moments ticked by and everyone else got comfortable. As Atreyu let Finch and Song out, Skena looked over to him and smiled softly. When Atreyu settled again, she went over to sit next to him, curling up against his side and murmuring that he was a good boy. "... Yeah. Doesn't... really surprise me..." Ludin murmured slowly in response to Luka's observations of his son. He sat in silence for several long moments, then, the silence stretching a bit uncomfortably as he looked like he was unsure about words lingering on the tip of his tongue.
Dakota 7/8/2023 7:09 PM
As Skena settled in, Atreyu shifted so he could curl around her and rest his great big head in her lap, heaving a stuttering sigh. Luka's gaze softened at the pair of them, at how sad the hound was. "I don't think I've ever seen Atreyu without Kaleva. Little wonder the poor thing's so melancholy." He exhaled a little laugh as he tipped his head back and rested it between Valentine's knees, his fingers absently stroking through the curly hair at the tip of her tail. Happy to fill in the quiet and keep things from being too awkward. "Victoria's going to give me an ear full once I get home. I'm not sure how wise it was to leave her in Szix's hands. Not that I don't trust he'll do a good job, but she doesn't care for him at all."
Daarka 7/8/2023 7:23 PM
"Who can blame her," Val mused warmly. "He's quite abrasive at the best of times. But there's blessedly few ways to screw up preparing some food for a cat." Skena's expression softened as she gently pet over Atreyu's face. "He'll be alright. Things will be back to normal soon," she murmured. Almost sounding like she was trying to convince herself of it now, too. Ludin hesitated, watching Atreyu's moping a moment. "... Everything's... alright? With... Kaleva...?" He said, the words sounding a little choked. Skena paused, realizing she hadn't given any thought towards how to word things with Ludin. Ludin, who still didn't explicitly know Kaleva was even a werewolf. "Everything's alright, yeah. He's just... been having some turbulent dreams that are messing with him." Not inaccurate, at least. "He has a friend he trusts to help with that stuff, so he's with them tonight. He should be back tomorrow." Probably. Hopefully. Ludin stared at the floor for a long moment, his jaw clenched again, and face forcibly blank. Silence stretched on again, tiny twitches of his eyes betraying an absolutely racing mind behind them. Finally, he stiffly set aside the bundle he had brought with him, placing his completely undrank tea on the coffee table. "... I'm... sorry for intruding. I should leave you to your evening," he said quietly, standing. Skena's brows furrowed slightly as she watched him get up, stand awkwardly a moment, and then take a step towards the door. Her lips parted, reflexively about to say her usual things. You don't have to leave... but thank you for coming... stay safe... we'll see you again soon... Instead, what came out was a quiet but slightly sharper, "Ludin?" He froze, minutely turning towards her ever so slightly to eye her like he was braced for some sort of reprimand. But Skena didn't look accusatory. Her brows remained knit, her eyes silently pleading. "... If... If you know something... something important about... our lives... please say what it is," she whispered, tears prickling at the corners of her eyes. There was an impossibly tense silence between them. She still didn't know the extent of what Ludin did or didn't know, but at least for those few heartbeats, they stared at each other with perfect understanding, and mutually conflicted, tied tongues about it. Finally, Ludin managed an almost inaudibly faint reply. "... Skena... I... I mean no harm. I don't. I swear I don't. But things... follow me. So I... need to go now." They stared at each other a moment more, both expressions twisted with things left unspoken, before Ludin stirred to motion again, and headed for the door.
Dakota 7/8/2023 8:18 PM
Luka watched with concern, his brow pinched, fingers stilling on Valentine's tail. Then, as the other tiefling made for the door, he called out softly, "...Are you in danger?"
Daarka 7/8/2023 8:20 PM
Ludin hesitated again, twitching slightly as he cast a stiff glance over his shoulder. "... Always," he mumbled weakly. And then turned to push open the door again, clearly very intent on getting outside before he could be stopped again.
Dakota 7/8/2023 8:22 PM
As Ludin left, Luka looked helplessly at Skena, clearly worried. Once he was fairly certain the man had departed far enough, he murmured to Skena, "Are you okay?"
Daarka 7/8/2023 8:24 PM
Skena's lips pressed tightly together, tears welling up in her already tear-ravaged eyes. "... No," she said quietly. Then, weaker, "... I don't know what to do."
Dakota 7/8/2023 8:31 PM
Clicking his tongue softly, Luka pushed to his feet and went to gather Skena into his arms, hugging her close. "It'll be okay," he murmured. "We're here. You're not alone. Whatever comes, we'll be right here to help you through it." Atreyu crawled forward on his belly, stretching his neck out until he could push his nose up under her hand, reminding her that while he didn't give very good hugs, he did have very soft ears for rubbing.
Daarka 7/8/2023 8:37 PM
He did. Her hand easily found them and got rubbing as she was gathered into Luka's arms, some of those tears spilling. "... I-I just wish I could... talk to Anubis about it," she whimpered weakly. "I just... I want to know what's going on. If there's... something I should be doing, I... If we're not supposed to be trusting Ludin, we don't know and it's... everything's too coincidental but it... it feels like all the pieces are there and I still can't connect them... and Kaleva's just suffering for it--"
Dakota 7/8/2023 8:49 PM
Luka seemed to pause for a moment, something occurring to him as he rubbed slow circles on her back. "...Achoris and I got together for tea the last time he was in town. He has his own special blend, of course, but... He mentioned that it also gave him a deeper attachment to Set. Made him dream of Him more often, opened up that communication. Now, it... I'm sure you know what is in the tea. But... would that be an option?"
Daarka 7/8/2023 8:57 PM
She sniffled. "... We shared that tea once, yeah... It... I'm... I'm not opposed to drinking that blend... There are rituals I grew up with that involve... eating the flesh of the deceased. I-I don't really do it these days, but it's not entirely foreign of a concept to me..." She heaved a heavy sigh. "... I could, but I... I don't know. I think... our Fathers probably dream with us when They want to. It'd be weird if a little dinky tea was what was holding Them back. I've had a hunch there was some other variable involved in making that happen... but... even if I forced a dream with Anubis... that doesn't guarantee me answers. He might not even have the answers." Her voice was small. "There are things beyond His knowledge. Things He can't foresee or isn't aware of. And... I'm... I'm worried that... the potential machinations of a demon might be one of those things He doesn't have a means of being aware of..."
Dakota 7/8/2023 9:24 PM
He nodded slowly. "I understand. It was just a thought... And even if He doesn't have answers, I thought He might at least be able to offer comfort... But you're right. Forcing such a thing would be rude." Breathing a sigh, he gave her a gentle squeeze. "Then, it seems as though there is little to do but wait... and I have a couple of potential distractions in mind if you need them. Card games I could teach. I've glued braille dots on the face sides of them for Valentine's benefit, so she can play with us too." And so the night passed, and a new day dawned. Jaska slept through until nearly two in the afternoon and woke ravenous, and Luka enlisted Valentine in helping him cook a nice meal for everyone. Jaska attempted to teach Skena how to play poker (and taught Axa too, explaining things to her in a murmur while she sat in his lap). Then, finally, as evening approached, the huskies kicked up a din of excited howling and Atreyu practically ran into the door in his enthusiasm to open it and get outside - where a very scratched up and disheveled Kaleva was promptly flattened beneath the dogs, spluttering and trying to pet all three of them at once.
Daarka 7/8/2023 9:26 PM
Beneath three dogs and one aasimar, who had launched herself up alongside the animals to follow suit as if she were no better than them. Except she had thumbs. And elbows. So she was able to pry the huskies aside and slither in under Atreyu's long legs until she could wrap her arms around Kaleva's middle, burying her face into his chest and just quietly lying on him. While the entire Piotovich family looked on, having most certainly not been there when Kaleva left.
Dakota 7/8/2023 9:43 PM
Now covered in slobber and dirt, Kaleva let out a faint wheeze, not even noticing the audience in the wake of such an enthusiastic greeting. The huskies finally got fed up with the pile they found themselves in, squeezing out and instead prancing around singing the song of their people, but Atreyu pinned both Skena and Kaleva between his forelegs and was whining deeply, licking them both and wagging his tail. Kaleva had felt... pretty distressed and down while he was away, and had nearly convinced himself that he'd return home to be met with caution and reservation, if not from Skena then from Atreyu and maybe the huskies too. But it was impossible to stay that way after such a greeting, and his heart felt full enough to burst. "Hey," he murmured to Skena with a smile that pulled at the scratches on his face. He looked like he'd gone a round or two with a lawnmower and lost.
Daarka 7/8/2023 9:44 PM
Skena finally lifted her head enough to actually look at the man she was sandwiched against, practically doing a double-take. "Are you okay?!" She exclaimed reflexively, eyes wide. "Did Roots eat you?!"
Dakota 7/8/2023 9:57 PM
"Stress testing," he said quietly, his smile going lopsided. "Had to work on my self control. No better way to do that than to make the beast angry. It's not perfect, but Roots and I are more confident in my ability to keep a lid on things now."
Daarka 7/8/2023 10:01 PM
"Really? It worked?" Her words overflowed with hope and relief to such an extent that... it was clear she had fully leapt into his arms without having even presumed things were under wraps again. She just wanted a hug. She'd suffer a bite for it if she had to. She sniffed, her eyes having welled up as the relief continued to messily crash through her. "Luka made breakfast, have you eaten? It's still out, I can get you a plate--"
Dakota 7/8/2023 10:34 PM
"Sort of, I mean... We still don't know what caused things to get that bad. And there are other options to explore if things take a turn for the worse, but basically... right now I just need to stop giving in to the things the beast wants, no matter how good it feels..." Her mention of Luka making food had him blinking and looking toward the doorway, spotting the assembled tieflings inside, and his face colored somewhat. "Oh.. uh. Let... Let me wash up first, I'm kind of a mess. But yeah, I could definitely eat."
Daarka 7/8/2023 10:36 PM
Skena glanced over her shoulder to follow his gaze, blushing a little herself. "Sorry, um. Jaska came over and... I guess I was enough of a mess that he offered to stay," she admitted quietly, wiggling to get off of Kaleva and prodding the giant dog over them both to do the same.
Dakota 7/9/2023 8:35 PM
"It's okay, I'm glad you weren't alone." As Atreyu let them up, Kaleva climbed to his feet and pulled Skena up too. Making his way inside, he nodded to the assembled Piotovichs. "Hey. Uh... I just wanted to thank you. For being here for Skena." Luka smiled warmly, maybe even a little misty-eyed at the reunion he'd witnessed. "It was Jaska's idea, really." Jaska made a disgruntled noise at him and rolled his eyes. "Don't make it into more of a thing than it was."
Daarka 7/9/2023 8:46 PM
Skena was right on Kaleva's heels as he made his way back inside, quietly fussing about healing up his various scrapes. And bite wounds. "I already hugged Jaska way more than he asked for. And cried on him. He's accepted more than his tolerance of appreciation, so he's off the hook on that front," she murmured, sniffling softly. Her eyes were still watery. "... Ludin dropped by, too. He left some furs I guess he wanted to give you," she added, gesturing to the bundle of leather and hides (from various small game; hares, racoons, and the like) that had been set aside for Kaleva.
Dakota 7/9/2023 9:03 PM
"Cooties," Jaska sniffed, pretending to look disgusted, though the effect was ruined by the faint upward curl at the corner of his mouth. "It'll never wash off. I'll need to go see a healer." Kaleva snorted with amusement and looked over the bundle let by Ludin. "Oh, these are nice. I can find good use for them, or trade them as needed." "Well, it looks as though you've had a trying time," Luka said gently, taking in the sight of the smaller tiefling's state. "We can head out if you would prefer, let you get settled in to relax without having to worry about playing host or anything. Food is in the kitchen, too." He considered Luka with a slight tilt of his head, wincing gently. "Honestly... I'd appreciate it. I'm not much in a state for company. I'm sorry--" "No, no apologies necessary. I left my cat in the care of an imp and Jaska hasn't even had the chance to go home after his trip from the guild, so I'm sure he and Axa are eager to get back home. We'll gather up our things and head out. It's good to have you back, Kaleva."
Daarka 7/9/2023 9:09 PM
"I am your healer," Skena murmured back amusedly to Jaska's bitching. Valentine shifted to get to her feet as her brothers roused to leave, reaching for her staff. "As Luka has said, I'm glad things are looking up for you all. Your dogs were certainly pitiful in your absence, so they are entitled to having you all to themselves for a while," she agreed warmly, reaching to take Luka's arm. Axa, of course, didn't even look towards their hosts, seemingly fully disinterested in the pleasantries as she stared off into space, padding over to stand at Jaska's heel. Skena gave a small smile towards Luka, though her gaze ultimately landed on Jaska. "... Thank you. Again," she said, her words quieter. "You're a better person than you think."
Dakota 7/9/2023 9:16 PM
"Only toward a very select few people," Jaska countered with a sniff. "I do have a reputation to maintain, you know." He took Axa's hand, and with one last nod toward the pair, headed for the door with his siblings and daughter in tow. After they'd departed, Kaleva breathed a sigh of relief. Not that he minded any of them, he just appreciated the quiet and the lack of company in his present state. "I'm going to go soak in the bath for a while," he murmured to Skena. He paused, then asked with a shy little smile, "...Join me?"
Daarka 7/9/2023 9:18 PM
Her warm smile towards him split into a similarly shy, lopsided little grin. "Yeah. That sounds nice. Here--" She abruptly skittered off into the kitchen, proceeding to load up a plate with various leftovers from breakfast, before heading back to the tiefling a moment later. "Breakfast in the bath. It'll be the peak of luxury," she declared, pushing the plate into his hands.
Dakota 7/12/2023 9:05 PM
------------------------------ Tonight was the night. And it would happen again, and again... Dexter references aside, Kaleva had things pretty decently under control, or so he thought. He was mindful not to give the inner beast too much control, and was presently gamboling about with the dogs, not yet transformed but chasing them around in a spirited game of keep away. Finch currently had the prize: The floppy remains of what used to be a leather ball, long since punctured, but still a prized possession often fought over by the canines. Kaleva could feel the tug of the moon as the sun set behind the hills, the urge to transform and hunt, but for the time being he resisted its call.
Daarka 7/12/2023 9:13 PM
Skena didn't go far from him, wanting to be nearby through the night. But she found herself absolutely brimming with pride for him and how mindful he was being, increasingly more and more confident that this was another hiccup life had thrown their way that they had figured out how to conquer. She'd make him a cake the following day or something; without a doubt, he'd earned it. She didn't have the spry endurance of the dogs nor Kaleva, but she couldn't help but get caught up in the game of theirs all the same, comfortably dressed in pajamas as darkness crept across the forest, chasing barefoot after Finch--though he easily evaded her. Four legs and all. Winded, she flopped unceremoniously down onto the grass to catch her breaath, letting her quarry escape as she eyed the full moon rising. She spared it a brief squint, as if to convey to the celestial body, I'm watching you, jerk, wheezing a moment before piping up to call out to Kaleva, "How you doin' over there?"
Dakota 7/12/2023 9:22 PM
Kaleva paused for breath, doubled over with his hands on his knees. Atreyu managed to pounce in and snag part of the ball in his jaws, and proceeded to yank his head up and launch Finch completely off his feet. But Finch didn't let go, instead hanging from his jaws and jerking while his body flopped around like a fish on a line, making punctuated yowls while Song jumped around them excitedly. "Doing okay," he wheezed, walking over to flop down next to Skena. "Feeling like I'm ready to vibrate out of my skin, but I have a leash on it. Pardon the pun."
Daarka 7/12/2023 9:27 PM
Skena giggled, turning her head to watch the dogs' antics a moment, before leaning over to plant a kiss on Kaleva's cheek. "I think you're doing amazing. I'm gonna have to figure out some sort of caffeine situation so I can stay up with you, make sure you don't start chasing your tail. I'd offer to bake cookies together or something, but I have a feeling that's too much not-enough-running-around for you right now."
Dakota 7/12/2023 9:35 PM
He sent her a little lopsided smile, his tail swishing back and forth lightly. "Yeah, sorry. I am not sure I should be going out to hunt tonight, I don't want to chance running across someone while in hunting mode until I'm sure I'll be keeping a handle on things during the full moon. But there's always other means of getting my energy out." Their firewood stack took up nearly an entire side of the cabin at this point.
Daarka 7/12/2023 9:39 PM
She snickered at that. "Yeah... at this rate, we might run out of all of them within a couple hours. But whatever it takes and all that." Heaving a sigh, she pushed herself to sit upright, stretching a little. "Mm... I can't keep up with the dogs anymore," she noted, watching Atreyu threaten to fling Finch into outer space, "But I can do some nighttime gardening while everyone's romping around out here." Which, with her, meant a fifty-fifty chance she was either doing actual gardening, or burying or digging up specimens in the process of decaying them.
Dakota 7/12/2023 9:57 PM
"That works. I--" he trailed off and burst into laughter as Atreyu lowered Finch back to his hind legs for just a moment, before whipping his head and upper body around in a move that launched Finch into the air. The copper-colored husky lost his grip and went flying, tumbling across the ground, but this wasn't his first rodeo with the Cautican hound. He was immediately on his feet and shaking himself off, running right back for more. "I think I'm going to get started on that chicken coop before I get too antsy."
Daarka 7/12/2023 10:00 PM
Skena looked over to appropriately marvel at the little three ring three dog circus going on, cackling a moment later. "It's such a good thing Tre knows to not be too rough," she wheezed. "My gods, I'd be constantly worrying otherwise." At Kaleva's proposed agenda, she pushed herself to her feet, turning to reach down and offer him a hand. Mostly in emotional support, and not for any substantial physical help, despite her best efforts. "I'm looking forward to seeing it done. And filled with extremely round birds."
Dakota 7/12/2023 10:12 PM
"Kinda want to get those chickens that have the black meat and bones... Ayam Cemani? Those would be cool to have around. The trick will be teaching the dogs not to harass them, but I think Atreyu will help a lot on translating that." Over the next couple hours, he worked diligently at building the coop, sawing the wood and measuring and nailing it into place. It was good physical work, but the higher the moon rose, the more distracted he became by the sounds of the forest around them. The dogs by now had completely tuckered out and were fast asleep. A rustling in the brush had the tiefling lifting his head and scenting the air, his pointed ears twitching and his tail flicking around.
Daarka 7/12/2023 10:23 PM
"Ooh yes!! I love those chickens." Skena went about her business adjacent to his, not always within eyesight of him, but never far enough for their joined rings to lose connection. A few times she interrupted what he was doing to bring him a drink, or a spare cookie, knowing that she wasn't really able to prepare the kind of snacks he probably craved most at that point. But she had wandered back towards her adjacent work, and he hadn't seen her for a little bit, as the rustling caught his attention. His keen senses didn't take long to hone in on the source; something small and strangely shaped, which a moment later he recognized as the coils of a serpent. While not immensely familiar with such animals himself, he'd seen them in nature enough to recognize the movement of its long, sinuous body in a rapid curling motion, and it wasn't hard to deduce that the rustling sound likely came from its quick strike that had seized some hapless mouse or the like. Which was now presumably being crushed to death in its coils. He watched it for a moment, what little of the event he could make out through the foliage, both mildly entranced by the little spectacle, and simultaneously tickled (in a very predatory way of his own) by the little movements. And then, as he watched the snake kill its mouse, the subtle enchantment on his amethyst ring--usually background noise in his mind--sputtered. And then flatlined.
Dakota 7/12/2023 10:29 PM
It took him a moment to realize. And when he did, it felt like ice water had poured straight over his heart and pooled into his stomach, filling him with horror and dread. He dropped what he was doing and was running before he even realized it, the transformation bursting from beneath his skin without thought or choice, black fur and large ears and long, wicked claws. He ran to where Skena was gardening, hoping, praying that it was a glitch in the magic, that the enchantment just failed, that nothing actually happened to her, but if something had hurt her... he was going to destroy whatever it was.
Daarka 7/12/2023 10:31 PM
He ran to the garden--but she wasn't there. It took him no time at all, however, to find her very fresh scent, following it until it led him away from the house... into the forest. All the while, the ring sat in heavy silence on his finger. As Kaleva ran, it was like the world around him came into perfect focus. Time almost slowed with how quickly his mind raced--and amongst those racing thoughts came an awareness of an odd feeling: deja vu. His mind was in overdrive, and one part of it distantly wondered at that sensation. What about this felt familiar? The answer came as he shoved through the trees, his gaze landing on a figure. Their back turned. The memory of his dream just two nights prior blended in and out of reality in a way that churned his stomach. The smell of rotting meat clotted into his senses. The fury that rose in him, the desire to rip and tear and kill-- It had never been a desire to kill Skena. He understood in a fraction of a second--and all too late--what that dream had truly portrayed, as he now saw the details laid out before him in far too much clarity. Ludin staggered slightly at the sound of Kaleva's approach, pivoting to face him with wide eyes and a rapidly paling complexion. His hands were empty, because his weapon--the insidious longsword--was presently skewered clean through the center of the small figure's chest, where she lay crumpled on the ground. Unmoving. Everything in Kaleva's body sang. The power that had coursed through him, radiated from him in that dream, now crashed through his veins again. It bade him to dominate, to destroy, to devour--and almost mockingly asked of him, How could you not? The strength with which it surged might have been unsettling, were the circumstances not so all-consuming on their own. Perhaps later, when afforded contemplation, Kaleva would realize... the beast had never been wrestled back into its bindings. It wanted to be here, in this moment. It wanted to be free in this moment. It bade its time to avoid the chains that would have prevented this. The beast of the curse was a primal thing. It vied for the accursed to succumb to base instinct and animalistic urges. It did not scheme. This force in his mind, in his heart, ringing through his blood... It was intelligent. And it was evil. And it had never spoken to Kaleva as loudly--nor made so compelling an argument--as it did in this moment. I am not asking for a saving throw. It is up to you to decide Kaleva's reaction.
Dakota 7/12/2023 10:48 PM
The scream that tore loose from Kaleva's throat was inhuman. Not just because of the transformation, but from the way it broke against Ludin like glass, raw and guttural, like something had been torn from him. He screamed like he knew it was hopeless, even, to scream. Grief and betrayal, denial and rage... Anubis' warning could not have been further from his mind in that moment. Seeing Skena pierced by that blade, knowing what that blade did... What was the point of being good? What was the point, without her? What was the point, when people would still take everything you cared about... People you'd trusted, given the benefit of the doubt, had even been starting to care for. Kaleva fell to his knees, his hands braced upon the ground, claws curled into fists. He felt... Cold. Everything felt cold. He felt no pain as his claws cut into his own skin, and they ignited with an icy, blue-green fire that seemed to drip like liquid from his claws. His lips were pulled back from his teeth as he stared at Ludin, and without a word spoken, promised a grisly and brutal death. The man had spent all his life running... But he would not be able to outrun this. He rushed at Ludin with a snarling roar. (edited)
Daarka 7/12/2023 10:58 PM
Ludin's own face was blank in horror. His lips were parted, but he couldn't find words. Not at the best of times--and these were anything but. He looked at the werewolf he knew to be his son, taking a few stumbling steps away. But there was something cold and hopeless in his demeanor. He didn't turn and run. He flinched back as Kaleva lunged, but did virtually nothing beyond his most base reflexes to defend himself. If he had been, all this time, like a wary, flighty animal that feared human kindness... the man now between Kaleva's claws was that animal cornered and wounded, and with no will left to survive.
Dakota 7/12/2023 11:06 PM
Kaleva... didn't remember much in the following moments. Everything that happened seemed distant, as though it were happening outside his body, to someone else. The numbness that had taken over left him a passive observer as he tackled Ludin to the ground, his jaws clamping around the tiefling's head. Teeth dug in deep, braced against the skull, and he bit down until he heard bone crack. His claws dug into his father's shoulders, his entire upper body wrenching back and forth to worry Ludin's form. There was no capacity for mercy or hesitation in Kaleva's heart. Just the cold certainty that Ludin had to die. And even that wasn't enough. He didn't make an effort to draw it out. In truth, he wasn't actually sure at what point Ludin died. He just... kept brutalizing the body, tearing into it, grabbing it and slamming it into the ground. Screaming, with no conscious choice to, or realization that he was.
Dakota 7/12/2023 11:31 PM
He became aware, eventually, that he'd stopped moving. The ravaged corpse he'd left of Ludin's body lay crumped on the ground, his blood splattered all over the place. He was no longer transformed, had no conscious memory of having changed back, but it was likely that the clock had simply run out on his ability to sustain it. He sat in front of Skena's body, the blade removed and set aside on the ground. He should have had it taken away before now. He should have had it destroyed the second Skena identified it. But there was nothing for it, now. Nothing but regret. He gathered Skena up into his arms. She'd want her body prepared, funeral rights performed. He'd known her long enough to know what that entailed. Ludin's body would be left to rot. Though... was there a point to it? Skena's soul would never make it into Anubis' care. Her body was an empty husk. And Ludin... His soul would be judged. That... That seemed appropriate enough. He'd briefly wished to have had the idea to stab him through with the blade so he could meet the same fate, but no... It was better that Anubis was left in control of what happened to His daughter's murderer. The blade couldn't be left behind, though. It was too dangerous to just leave for anyone to pick up.
