He shifted his gaze to Axa then, and reached out to hold his hand out to her, beckoning her to his side. Assuming she did, he would take one of her hands in his, and meet her gaze. "Axa... Valentine says she can have a containment ready in a couple of hours. As Ingrid explained, Skena has been turned into a lemure and is in Hell. Would it be possible for you to summon her specifically?"
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:08 PM
There was stunned silence for a moment in Jaska's mind. When his sister's voice returned, it was that of an even-toned, calculating strategist. 'Give me an hour, and I will either come to you with something workable, or I will reach out and update you on my progress.' Axa padded over, reaching to take his extended hand. She stared blankly at a random point on his chest, her tail continuing to tensely flick as silence stretched out. "... M... Maybe...?" She ultimately squeaked, a sort of muted anxiety oozing from the faint words. She had never summoned a lemure before. She... never wanted to see a lemure ever again. She also had never tried to summon a specific entity. She didn't know if she could. She turned inside out to do as Jaska asked of her--to the letter--in every single situation. There was a visible panic starting to rise in her as she took in the uncharacteristic and disturbing change in his demeanor that preceded this request. He liked Skena. He wanted her back. What would he do if she failed?
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:16 PM
Jaska keyed into that rising panic, and lifted his other hand to her cheek. "I know it's a lot to ask. I ask this knowing that you may not be able to, and if that is the case, we will find another way. All I need from you is that you try, once we have the containment ready. Can you try for me?"
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:17 PM
Another long silence. Axa swallowed tightly, and gave a tiny nod.
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:18 PM
He drew her in, pressing a soft kiss to her forehead. "That's my girl. We have a bit of time before that happens. Do you need anything to prepare?"
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:20 PM
She looked around slowly, visibly wracking her mind and still doing so through a not-insignificant amount of stress. Ultimately she... gave a slow shake of her head. Ingrid's eye twitched in the faintest hint of a squint at the little girl. Who could... summon a specific lemure from hell (allegedly) without any reagents. Something to unpack later.
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:24 PM
Nodding, Jaska rose to his feet, and went to go fetch Axa's weighted blanket that he could wrap around her and help her through this waiting period without getting too worked up, hopefully. The more a plan of action unfolded, the less shaken he seemed to be, his own mind working toward other possibilities and avenues that could be explored if this one didn't work out. "Ingrid. Thank you for bringing this to me. You mentioned the man that killed her had no intention or control over doing so. Do you know who compelled him to do it?"
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:29 PM
"No bloody idea," she replied. "The man turned out tae be Kaleva's dad. He led the elf an' me tae the pulverized mess of 'em in the woods... poor lad really made a chew toy outta him. Cannae blame 'em even slightly. Elf lass did some voodoo an' started interrogatin' the corpse; when it became clear the miserable sod hadnae killed the wee lass on purpose, had no intentions tae do so--an' even the corpse was gushin' apologies--Kaleva took pity on 'em, I s'pose. Fished out a diamond from somewhere, had the man resurrected. Still a bit chewed up, even with breath in 'em, so he's recoverin' with the elf at the moment. Everyone else is back at Kaleva's home. An' by everyone, I mean Kaleva an' Achoris." Squint. "An' Gummy." (edited)
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:30 PM
Jaska's lips parted, words caught for a moment before he echoed with some confusion, "Gummy? ...I didn't think that creature was capable of existing without Skena."
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:35 PM
"Aye, bit of a curiosity, that. No one's particularly clear on what's goin' on with that wee phenomenon." Ingrid shrugged, drifting off for a moment in thought. "... Almost wonder if... Listen, Ah donnae ken ass about shite with necromancy. Nae me thing. But I was under the impression the wee brat was powered with the lass' lifeforce, yeah?" She made a bit of a face, idly scratching along her jaw. "Cannae help but wonder if... the lass bein' in another body, even on another plane, was enough tae reinstate that tether. Ah ken me own Delilah probably focks back off tae the Feywild if Ah croak, but that cunt ain't necromancy. She's conjured, nae constructed. Donnae fully understand the rules with a thing like Gummy."
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:40 PM
Jaska made an absent gesture with one hand. "I can't think of any better explanation. Death and the manipulation of life force are things I am intimately familiar with, but that isn't the same thing." Bringing the blanket over, he knelt in front of Axa and wrapped her up in it. "Do you want to tuck away on top of the icebox and hide for a bit? Ingrid and I can move to the kitchen so I'll be near."
Daarka 7/17/2023 7:44 PM
Axa mutedly accepted the blanket around her, her hands shifting to grab and secure it in place. But she shook her head at his question, just staring at a point on the floor, even shuffling a few inches closer to Jaska in a way that betrayed a pique in her separation anxieties. Because if she failed to be useful, why would he keep her around? Ingrid watched him dote on her, sighing softly. "... Kaleva has some hourglass. Nae sure quite where it came from--he's gone mute what with all this goin' on, an' again, cannae blame 'em--but he seems tae be indicatin' it's origin has somethin' tae do with Anubis. Fock if I know. No one knows what it's countin' down tae, either."
Dakota 7/17/2023 7:52 PM
He let out a low hum and then just gathered Axa up into his arms, tucking her against his narrow hip and motioning Ingrid to follow with a gesture of his chin as he headed into the living room and sat down on the couch with his child. "Wouldn't be the strangest part of this whole affair. Skena's quite fortunate that she has such a wide variety of allies. But I'm not happy about the identity of her killer being a mystery. I'll have to look into Kaleva's father and see who he's run into and why they would use him to kill Skena." A frown pinched his lips. "With it being Kaleva's father being the tool used to kill her, I wonder if this wasn't a means of getting at Kaleva himself somehow. That Skena's death was targeted more to affect him than her."
Daarka 7/17/2023 8:05 PM
"Cannae speak on that much meself," Ingrid mused, following after him. "We neighbors an' old friends, but we donnae catch up on all the nitty-gritty goin's-on in our lives. Nae that kind'a relationship... but..." She paused, sighing. "... Last I saw him anythin' like this, it was when the poor lad was put in jail. A horrid betrayal by the woman he loved at the time. I sucked off the guards tae be able tae see him as often as I could. He wouldnae speak then, either. So I just... sat, an' tried tae keep 'em company. Nae sure what good it did in the moment, but none of his other supposed friends made an effort." A beat. "... If ye just waitin' tae hear back from ye sister... would ye be opposed tae waitin' at Kaleva's? Ah hate leavin' 'em like this. Think he needs someone tae sit with him an' be a bit of stability right now. He likes Achoris, but that man looked like he wanted tae go tae war... not sure that helps soothe the poor lad at the moment." Another pause. "Ah ken ye hate the spindly fock, though, so if ye rather be here, I won't beg." Her features pinched slightly. "... Cannae be very easy for ye, either. Wouldnae feel great leavin' ye alone unless ye preferred it that way."
Dakota 7/17/2023 8:31 PM
Jaska let out a grunt. "I abhor Achoris, but on this situation I can't see we'd be opposed about much of anything. I've been forced to endure worse company." A pause, and then a quiet confession, "I also would rather not sit and stew, otherwise I anticipate a spiral that will be pleasant for no one. And the more collected I am, the more collected Axa will be." Exhaling shortly, he got back to his feet and went to the door, slipping his shoes on without disturbing the child in his arms. "Let's go, then."
Daarka 7/17/2023 8:35 PM
Ingrid nodded, quietly relieved he'd at least not be alone. "We all got a common goal here, at least. An' bein' in one place will help make collaboratin' on a solution far easier. Kaleva might be able tae answer more of ye curiosities about his dad that I don't have answers tae, s'well." She turned to leave with him, walking alongside him as he carried Axa, who seemed content to stay nestled against him. "... Anythin' I can do for ye, though? It's strange circumstances, but... if there is somethin' ye need of me, I want ye tae ask."
Dakota 7/17/2023 8:38 PM
"Presently, no. But I may call upon you for that offering later." He glanced to Ingrid, then away, but for all that he put on a distracted and distant air, there was a measure of gratitude there for her. A new light that he saw her in, someone who was dependable and level-headed in a crisis, no matter how she portrayed herself usually.
Daarka 7/17/2023 8:45 PM
"The offer doesnae expire," she confirmed smoothly, and left it at that. She could tell he was looking at her differently than he had in the past, and she was hardly surprised. It took a lot to pass the threshold of things she didn't take seriously and break into the territory of things she did, to the point where only a small handful of individuals had ever seen the latter out of her. A growing number as of today, though. Seeing the same out of Arsast was going to make Jaska's head spin. She led him back into town, to Finders Keepers, where she paused within the home to check in on the satyr in question. Seeing what he was up to, she advised him Jaska seemed to have something in the works in terms of containing a lemure--but she knew he needed something to do with himself, so she pointed out that the growing collection of people in Kaleva's home (the poor man himself included) would eventually need something to eat, but probably have none of the wherewithal to be consciously remembering to feed themselves. Once he was brought up to speed and given something to occupy himself with (whether or not he went with that in the end, she at least wanted to present a suggestion), she continued on through the portal to the cottage, looking around for Kaleva to go return to his side.
Dakota 7/17/2023 8:57 PM
Arsast had amassed a collection of containers he'd found in the shop, from bird cages to hope chests (he had no idea how big a lemure actually was, but it sounded like lemur, and those were small, and the only other real Hell being he'd seen was Luka's imp and that was pretty small), but upon hearing Valentine was taking care of that, he heaved a sigh of relief, and then perked up at Ingrid's suggestion of feeding people. There was a random person in the shop who had a few items in a basket, and the woman blinked as Arsast rushed up to her. "Hey i'mreallysorry but I need to close up the shop, we're mourning and I need to go buy groceries." "O-oh, okay yeah, could I just purchase these and--" "Nah, take 'em, you can have 'em." The bewildered customer obligingly was shuffled toward the door. "Thank you, god bless ye merry gentlemen, I love you, have a good day." He then closed the door and flipped the sign to closed and ran off to go get his coinpurse. Jaska let out a muffled, also bewildered snort and followed Ingrid up the stairs toward the door. (edited)
Dakota 7/17/2023 9:30 PM
While they were gone, Kaleva had curled up in his and Skena's bed, his nose buried in the pillow as he tried to drink in every molecule of her scent he could pick up, with Gummy tucked against his chest in one arm, and the hourglass held in the other, watching the black sands fall with a sort of meditative and listless stare. Achoris had occupied himself as he could, and was presently sitting on the floor in the living room with Anouke, inspecting her paws for any damage she might have incurred on the travel back, and cleaning between her paw pads and applying balm to them. He glanced up as Ingrid returned, doing a quick double-take and a pinched squint of an aborted scowl toward Jaska before he returned his attention to the dog. "Kaleva's in the bedroom."
Daarka 7/17/2023 9:39 PM
"Thank ye kindly. Play nice," she murmured, not dwelling on the subject of the two asshole men's relationship, before moving towards the bedroom. Cracking the door, she peeked inside, then slipped in all the way, quietly walking around to the side of the bed Kaleva was facing, and squatting down with a sigh. By now, roughly three quarters of the black sand was at the bottom of the hourglass. "... Hangin' in there, beloved?" A beat, and she waved her hand dismissively. "Stupid question, ignore it. Jaska's got his sister an' daughter on it. We just waitin' on hearin' back from Valentine, now, once she's done whatever she needs tae do tae create some way of trappin' a lemure or whatnot. Jaska an' Axa are in the other room now." She cocked her head slightly, her gaze lidded and gentle. "... Jaska had a lot of curiosity about mister Nowhere, wanted tae work on figurin' out who might'a compelled 'em tae do this. We probably got a little time until Val has her shite together, if ye feel like workin' with Jaska there." A beat. "Ye not obligated tae, though. Ye can just lay here like this as long as ye need, if ye prefer it." (edited)
Dakota 7/18/2023 7:52 AM
Kaleva shifted his attention to Ingrid when she returned, reaching over for the book and opening it to the page he'd written his previous words on, taking the quill and scratching out a single name. It was a little awkward to do while laying on his side, but he managed. 'Fenrir.' (edited)
Daarka 7/18/2023 8:32 AM
Ingrid squinted, tilted her head as she regarded the writing. "... Fenrir... the god? Compelled 'em tae do it? Hm." No point in really asking how he knew that with him being mute. "I imagine that makes more sense tae ye than it does me. But aight." A beat. "Ye need anythin', beloved? When's the last time ye drank some water?"
Dakota 7/18/2023 8:39 AM
Kaleva shrugged as if to signify it was his best guess, elaborating with a few more written lines. 'We are descended of Fenrir. He was with the Blackswords, who worship Fenrir. They gave him the sword.' He hesitated, then added, 'When he was being resurrected, I saw him trapped under Fenrir's claws. I had to pull him out. We got help from... Something. Another god, I think. I didn't recognize her.' He didn't respond to her other question about when he last drank something. He didn't know. Though it would explain the throbbing in his skull.
Daarka 7/18/2023 8:43 AM
Ingrid looked over the writing a moment, nodding slowly. "... Mind if I borrow that? Gonna show it tae Jaska. Better than me tryin' tae repeat it in full." If he handed over the tome, she'd take it in one hand, her other reaching out to briefly, compassionately touch the back of his, before standing and disappearing back into the main room. She kept the book open to the page Kaleva had written on, handing it towards Jaska wherever he had settled himself. "Kaleva seems tae know the culprit. Might be a bit out'a any of our leagues."
Dakota 7/18/2023 8:49 AM
The two men in the living room were doing a remarkable job of basically ignoring each other's existence, though both focused on Ingrid when she came in. Jaska took the book and read over it with a frown. "...I have a man in my employ who was a Blacksword. He tried to steal from me, and I persuaded him to work for me instead. I doubt he knows much of relevance, but he may be worth questioning anyway. And even if we can't feasibly destroy Fenrir himself, we can at least wipe out his cult. Led by a man named Ivolde, if my memory serves." (edited)
Daarka 7/18/2023 8:54 AM
"Hm. May be good tae interrogate ye man, but... cannae say any of this means anythin' tae me. Can always ask around, see if Ars or even Lakaar has heard of this shite, but if ye lookin' for gossip, I'd think ye sister would be a better route there." She made a bit of a face. "I got plenty'a gossip, me. But tends tae be of a different variety. Don' typically pay much mind tae what is happenin' in fock knows where." But she could still be useful. Presently, that took the form of closing the book again, and heading into the kitchen to fill up a glass of water, before returning to the bedroom. The book was slid across the bed within reach of Kaleva again, and she offered out the glass. "Ye need ye strength an' good health for anythin' tae come. Please try tae choke it down, beloved."
Dakota 7/19/2023 7:31 PM
Kaleva pushed himself up to sit with a small sigh, but he didn't refuse, taking the glass in hand and drinking from its contents. His tufted tail slid out and curled around Ingrid's nearest appendage, a silent request for comfort, even if he didn't quite look at her as he did so. It even gave her the faintest of tugs.
Daarka 7/19/2023 7:41 PM
Ingrid was effortlessly coaxed down next to him, squishing up against his side and gently cradling his head against her shoulder, her thin, excessively long tail swirling in weightless knots around his. Gummy made a faint croak as he was mildly squished between them, but stayed put where he had wedged himself under Kaleva's chin. "We gonna make it right, beloved. Promise." A beat. "An' when it's all taken care of, I'm gonna ask ye why that wee child can summon shite from hell without so much as an arcane focus." Her hand pat over his hair gently. "But that can wait." There was a short stretch of silence, before she continued, her tone calm and soothing. "Cannae help but wonder what Ars is up tae. Ah told 'em everythin', 'course, an' the poor lad needs somethin' tae do when things ain't right, or he just... threatens tae vibrate himself intae wee pieces with that nervous energy. Believe he's currently tryin' tae get some food whipped up tae feed the army ye got in the livin' room that's growin' by the hour." She exhaled softly, her breath smelling faintly of lavender. "Now it's just a guessin' game of what kind'a food he deems appropriate for the occasion. Could literally be anythin'. Anythin'. Like playin' a little gamblin' game in me mind, figurin' out what I'd even expect out of 'em in such a situation." The words were idle thoughts, but... it was what she had done for him in prison, too. An attempt to give him something normal, something that didn't feel so mired in his current misery. Something to tether him back to reality, to make it feel like things were just slightly less of a calamity. To carry a conversation he need not participate in, but could still be a part of. "Donnae suppose ye have any guesses as tae what happens at the end of this," she continued musingly, tapping a manicured nail lightly on the top of the hourglass he held. "... Cannae perfectly remember what it looked like last ye pulled it out in front'a me. How fast it goin'? How much time that remainin' sand amount tae?"
Dakota 7/19/2023 7:45 PM
He settled in against her, his cheek resting on her shoulder, eyes drifting closed as he let himself be lulled and comforted by the sound of her voice and the smell of her breath. He gave a little wince and a one-shouldered shrug at the mention of Axa's summoning. It wasn't something he could spill the beans on. Wasn't his secret to give. Shouldn't have even suggested it in front of the others, but... he hadn't been thinking clearly. Too desperate for solutions. As she went on to mention the hourglass, he reached for the book to pull into his lap, opening it on one thigh and writing down, 'Anubis gave it to me in a dream. He said I had 24 hours to grieve, and then we had work to do.'
Daarka 7/19/2023 7:59 PM
Ingrid cocked her head to read his writing, humming softly. "Twenty-four hours from last ye slept, then? So sometime intae this evenin', or night." She squinted back at the hourglass, sizing up the ratio of sand on either side of the glass. "... If Ah had tae try tae put the visual of that tae numbers... maybe a handful of hours left, aye?" She took a deep breath, letting out an easy sigh. "Well. It'll be a curious surprise, then. If it's anythin' threatenin', ye certainly got more than enough firepower in the other room tae face it confidently." A thoughtful pause. "... Unless its a bloody... dragon or somethin'. Mm... Ah dinnae ken, Ah think this lot could fight a dragon. Dependin' on the kind. We pretty capable, all in one bunch. Don' know what a dragon would be doin' in this mess, though. Ah don' know shite 'bout the gods," she snorted. "Nae much 'bout hell, either. Now, if Skena had been reincarnated intae a weed plant--then we talkin'. But Ah got a very specialized skillset, for better or worse." Her hand against his head idly ran her nails through his hair, playing softly with the strands. "But that's no issue when ye got such a colorful cast'a folks what would bloody kill for the wee lass. An' I'm sure if it was ye needin' tae be dragged out'a hell, those same folks would be here, helpin' Skena just as fervently. That's the nice thing about livin' well. Good things follow. Whether ye intend tae or not, ye end up buildin' a big cushy net tae fall back ontae should ye need it. Ye got a good one, here. This net got fockin' connections. Connections tae whole-ass gods, tae--fockin'--quasi-deities, tae hell. Shite, beloved, ye stacked on this one. Ye even got a wily wee goat cookin' for ye. Ah think the most insurmountable task in all of this would be tryin' tae figure out what that food is gonna be. Took us all of five minutes with our heads together tae make a plan for Skena--but even Arsast might not know what he's preparin'." She just kept talking. Slow, steady, her voice just as much an embrace as her arms. Idle ramblings that would have been a waste of breath at any time prior to this, but in this moment, were a grounding filler for what otherwise could have been a silent spiral. She would keep chatting, largely without prompting him for response, in this manner indefinitely, unless he posed some sort of communication towards her. (edited)
Dakota 7/19/2023 8:18 PM
Kaleva seemed to appreciate the chatter and the distraction it gave. It was something to focus his thoughts on, the soothing cadence of her brogue. A little while later, there was some thudding at the door that sounded more like a kick than a knock. Jaska went to open the door, blinking as Arsast juggled a pan, a casserole dish, and a pot with oven mitts on both hands, his chin propped on top of a couple of smaller lidded bowls on top. "...Just how many people were you expecting to feed?" "I dunno!! I didn't think to ask! But also leftovers are great, they won't have to worry about cooking for like... two weeks!" Arsast took everything into the kitchen and started setting it out on the table. "I made lasagna, chili, and a zucchini and feta egg bake. There's sour cream and cheese for the chili, and I brought chocolate truffle cookies, and sugar cookies, and peanut butter cookies, for Skena, you know, when she's back. Do you think she still just eats sugary stuff as a lemur?" "Lemure," Jaska corrected after a long pause. "Yeah, that!" "...I have no idea."
Daarka 7/19/2023 8:22 PM
Ingrid's gentle ramblings paused as she heard the undeniable arrival of her other half, and a soft, amused smile split her features. "... 'Mon, beloved. Let's go solve the biggest mystery in all'a this, an' get some good food intae ye body." She roused to try to gently bring him up with her. "Even if ye got no appetite--and I couldnae blame ye--treat ye body like a machine. Ye gonna need ye strength for whatever is tae come, especially if that hourglass is actually countin' down tae a dragon showin' up. Ye body gonna need the fuel."
Dakota 7/19/2023 8:32 PM
Kaleva nodded and let out a heavy sigh, setting aside the book and tucking Gummy up to his shoulder as he climbed up off the bed and made his way to the kitchen. The smell of the food made his stomach growl audibly - understandable, it'd been about a day and a half since he'd eaten. Arsast was arranging the cookies into a spiral in a container, leaving some out for people to eat, but saving most of them for Skena. It was like a month's supply of food for the aasimar. He looked up at Kaleva and beamed proudly. "Hungry? Help yourselves! Where's Skena, I want to give these to her." When Kaleva motioned toward Skena's back room, he went in and said cheerfully to the corpse, "Hi, Skena! I brought food! I know you're probably not hungry right this second but I figure cookies keep for a good while, and I had this container that is enchanted to keep things fresh, so I thought it'd be perfect to keep your cookies in so when you're back you have ready options, because I bet you're gonna be famished. You might even eat two cookies!" Hearing Arsast cheerfully talking to Skena's corpse had tears welling quickly in Kaleva's eyes, and he had to wipe them away as he went to get plates and bowls out for people.
Daarka 7/19/2023 8:34 PM
Ingrid couldn't help but smile as she listened to Arsast address the corpse, and she gave Kaleva's back a soft rub, before moving to help him sort out the dinnerware. About fifteen minutes passed, before Jaska would get the message he'd been waiting for. 'Alright. I think Luka and I have everything we need. Where should we go?'
Dakota 7/19/2023 8:38 PM
'Skena and Kaleva's place. Axa and I are already here.' A pause. 'Achoris is as well, but he's barely spoken a word. Small blessings.' Neither Jaska or Achoris had touched the food, Achoris for obvious reasons to any who knew him, and Jaska because he had eaten earlier and had no appetite anyway. But Kaleva had taken a small serving of each of the dishes Arsast brought, and had nearly polished them all off when Jaska spoke up. "They're on their way. They'll be here shortly."
Daarka 7/19/2023 8:48 PM
'Be there shortly.' Less than ten minutes passed, before there was another knock on the door, which Ingrid got up to answer. Val stepped inside, taking a deep breath. "Jaska, dear?"
Dakota 7/19/2023 8:52 PM
Achoris knelt rigidly on the floor next to Anouke, who watched everything with a sort of queenly indifference, her front legs folded over each other. "Hi Val! Hi Luka!" Arsast garbled from around a mouthful of food from the kitchen. Luka followed Valentine in, and gave Ingrid a nod, and a gentle smile to Achoris. Jaska stood up and approached her. "Right here."
Daarka 7/19/2023 8:56 PM
Val nodded, slipping off of Luka's arm and heading towards Jaska's voice. "Hello Arsast. And everyone else." She didn't dwell on pleasantries. "We've done our best to study up on a manner of containment for a summoned fiend. The main issue is the duration; most of this magic is not meant to be an indefinite fixture. That said... I'm reasonably confident I could push it to a twenty-four hour duration. And then maintain it with daily recasting." That was presuming quite a bit of effort from Valentine, but she seemed to have signed herself up for it without question. "We need a space to draw the circle--maybe five feet in diameter, at a minimum. Somewhere that such an entity could be kept for the duration."
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:00 PM
Kaleva set aside what remained of his food and went to start shoving the couch away from the fireplace to clear up more room in the living room, Achoris immediately moving to help him clear it while he had Anouke go outside and wait. Jaska watched them do it, his arms folded. "How long does it take to cast?"
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:02 PM
"Not long; a minute or so," Val murmured. "Mostly just comprised of drawing the circle. It'll provide containment for a fiend that can be summoned within its bounds, who then will not be capable of moving beyond those limits." Her expression softened slightly, and a moment passed, before she spoke again, a bit gentler. "... How is the little one doing?"
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:06 PM
"Stressed," Jaska sighed. "She's not sure if she can do it." Luka went to help roll up the rug in front of the fire and set it against the wall, dusting his hands off on his legs. "Here is fine, then?" He gestured to the floor, and Kaleva gave him a nod.
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:10 PM
Val nodded in gentle understanding. "If she can't," she replied, deliberately spoken so Axa could hear her without issue, "It's no trouble. To summon a fiend is not the most challenging thing in this equation. Fiends want to be summoned, it's how they do business. The only hang-up will be in ascertaining if Skena's name, as we know it, is one that still technically applies to her in some reincarnated form, and would thus be a manner by which to specify her in the summoning. But of all the extraplanar entities... fiends are certainly the easiest to bring to the material. There is very little obstacle created if she is not able to do it."
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:13 PM
"I thought as much," Jaska said with a nod, and turned to Axa, kneeling in front of her and cupping her cheek in his palm. "Nothing bad will happen if you are not able to summon her, Axa. I promise you that. I know this is a lot to ask of you."
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:16 PM
Axa didn't really look at him, still seeming to be a small little emotionless ball of tension. Val sighed quietly, but the stress levels couldn't be helped. Best she could do was try to be productive. So she reached out for Luka's hand. "Alright. Show me the boundaries of the space you've cleared," she murmured, her other hand leaving her staff (which inexplicably remained standing upright) and turning palm-up, with inky black tendrils of some sort of ichor bleeding in reversed gravity from her hand, and leaving behind a stick of chalk that shimmered faintly.
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:19 PM
Luka took her hand, finding something nostalgic in the seamless way in which they worked together to accomplish setting the circle. Jaska had never witnessed this outside of Luka's eyes before, and watched with a slight tilt of his head, rather easily able to imagine them as youngsters practicing their first spells together. Achoris stood next to Kaleva, his arms folded tightly as he watched, both of them tense.
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:29 PM
There was a sort of magical twin intuition the two were able to tap into when working side by side, barely even needing to coordinate through speech with how well they were on the same page. It was truly their bread and butter, and in the span of a quick minute, the two had drawn out a pristine spell circle over the floorboards. With a last flick of the chalk, a faint shimmer rippled across the runes and linework. The stick of chalk was done away with in a similar manner by which it had arrived, and Val's hand extended behind her, with her staff drawing itself back into her grasp as if by a magnet. As her fingers closed around it again, her eyes were drowned in inky blackness almost akin to Achoris', and her free hand hovered over the runes in front of her without touching them. Even Luka seemed to act as a conduit for that magic, and for a brief second, it was almost like those watching could see the power channeled into Luka from his sister, as a flash of magic sparked on the runes like a crack of electricity, setting them ablaze in a steady orange glow. It wasn't really a comment directed at Achoris, but he would hear the grumbling under Ikiro's breath all the same, accompanied by a terse little sniff. ... It's at least a very well-constructed circle. The tabaxi, of course, did not think kindly of Val or Jaska much more than Achoris did; Val had, after all, threatened to steal him. But also... game recognized game. Val sighed as she leaned back, her eyes clearing again. "... I believe that does it," she murmured, getting back to her feet to clear out of the way.
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:33 PM
Achoris made a silent hum of reply in response to Ikiro's comment, on much the same wavelength as the tabaxi. He also knew enough to be able to appreciate it. "All right then." Jaska turned to Axa once more. "Are you ready to give it a try, child? I'll be right with you."
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:48 PM
Axa stared emptily at the circle for a long moment, before very hesitantly starting to pad towards it. She stood at its edge, staring over the glowing runes for several seconds, before slowly crouching into a squat. She swallowed tightly, the tip of her tail very tensely flicking back and forth a moment. Then she shifted to plant her little hands against the floor, running her fingers over the wood briefly, before curling them to jab her claws into the material, steadily beginning to carve lines on the immediate perimeter of her aunt and uncle's circle. Little shuffling steps in her crouch brought her around its full circumference, leaving gnarled scratches in the wood that looked both arbitrary and... somehow deliberately patterned all at once. When her own circle was closed, she sat motionless for a few seconds, her tail still making tight little jerks that betrayed the stress otherwise imperceptible from her face. She seemed to reluctantly overcome her hesitation after a short pause, and her claw dragged a line inward. As the circle she had made contacted the one Val had created, the gentle orange light immediately bled into a blood red, and the runes Val and Luka had so carefully placed seemed to warp slightly--not losing their position, not becoming undone, but as if now portrayed through a different lens. The chalk became black, the shapes and runes taking on an appearance that, to anyone familiar with the infernal script, would look reminiscent of such writing. Some of the runes began to smolder or flicker with flames that put off wisps of black smoke. Those looking at Axa would find her eyes... a little bit less albino-pink, and a little more beady red. Then her features went slack, brows raised a fraction like she suddenly found herself taken aback. Her eyes raced back and forth over the space in front of her, and the spell circle that had begun to smolder steadily seemed to lose the power that made it do so, its appearance and conflagration mellowing back to the shimmering chalk and orange glow it had been before, as Axa looked around in... nothing short of bewilderment, her breaths shallow and panicked.
Dakota 7/19/2023 9:53 PM
It seemed like everyone in the room held their breath, watching and waiting to see what happened. But when the glow faded, and nothing appeared, Kaleva's shoulders slumped slightly. Jaska stepped up beside Axa, reaching down to gently place his hand upon her head. "It's all right. You did your best, and I'm proud of you for trying." He knelt down beside her, leaning in to try to look into her face. "Breathe deep, slow breaths, darling. It's all right."
Daarka 7/19/2023 9:57 PM
Axa was... not soothed. Her wide eyes continued to jump around the circle, her claws and tail twitching. There was a powder keg of a stretch of silence, before she choked out, "I did it right!" And given her usual manners of speech, the confused and nearly indignant declaration might as well have been a scream. Val certainly blinked at it, though she said nothing just yet, her head cocked as she tried to process that. She had... budding questions, but it was more important for Jaska to take the reins and simmer the poor devil down.
Dakota 7/19/2023 10:01 PM
He didn't doubt her for a second. "Then something else must have interfered with the summoning and prevented it from being completed," Jaska said, looking toward the circle with a thoughtful frown. Kaleva wasn't... entirely surprised. He'd had the feeling it wouldn't be so simple. Anubis had something planned, clearly. Maybe He'd known it wouldn't work.
Daarka 7/19/2023 10:06 PM
Axa looked like she was barely hanging on by a thread. Something about autists and expected outcomes. But while she looked like a landmine on a hair trigger, Ingrid, at least, did not know enough about her to want to fully shut her whore mouth and let Jaska handle it. She cleared her throat softly. "... Can I... Mm. Maybe ye should," she mumbled, half to herself, before looking to Jaska. "Can ye ask her... what she would have expected tae happen if... there wasnae a Skena lemure?" She wondered carefully. Ingrid didn't know extraplanar entities as well as some others--but she was a professional enchanter. She was familiar with the reality of spells failing simply because what the caster was trying to do was logistically impossible. ‚ÄúIf what she was summonin‚Äô just‚Ä¶ dinnae exist?‚Äù (edited)
Dakota 7/21/2023 7:32 PM
Jaska blinked at Ingrid, and then looked back to Axa. "Does that sound like it may be what happened? That perhaps Skena is not, presently, a lemure, and cannot therefore be summoned in the way the spell was fashioned?" Kaleva furrowed his brow and shared a look with Achoris, who quirked a brow back at him, and then to the assembled people. "Is that possible? The sword is designed to send those souls directly to hell to be turned into lemures..." Both brows rose then, and he hummed. "Though perhaps because she is the daughter of a deity whose entire purpose is to gatekeep and direct which souls go to Heaven or Hell... Perhaps He was able to catch her and prevent that particular fate." "I don't see why that couldn't be the case," Luka mused thoughtfully. "Though would that mean she could be resurrected in the traditional manner?" Kaleva held up the hourglass and gestured to it with a confused grimace. If so, why the countdown? Why say there was something else to be done?
Daarka 7/21/2023 7:50 PM
Axa looked over the spell circle in distress, silent a moment as she thought. "... M-Maybe..." She didn't look soothed by that. If it was impossible, it was like being set up to fail. That wedged under her skin in a way that kept her from settling. Valentine squinted thoughtfully, tilting her head. "... Is that Gummy I hear?" She wondered after a moment, belatedly realizing the unexpected ambiance of the faint rattle coming from the little minion around Kaleva's shoulders.
Dakota 7/21/2023 7:53 PM
"...Yes," Achoris replied after a long moment, staring at the minion. "He sounds so crunchy and croaky normally, is he purring?" Kaleva blinked and tucked away the hourglass so he could take Gummy into his hands and examine him.
Daarka 7/21/2023 7:55 PM
Val gave a low, curious hum. "... Gummy, the minion... fueled by Skena's lifeforce?" She continued, both pointedly and slowly as she ensured she wasn't missing a vital detail of context. Gummy gave a dry little croak as he was pulled from his perch, his stubby legs sticking out askew, but his body hanging with relaxed limpness as he stared blankly at Kaleva.
Dakota 7/21/2023 8:53 PM
Kaleva stared at him a long moment, then set him back on his shoulder and took out the book that he could write in it and show it to Achoris to say out loud. "...Kaleva says he found Gummy unresponsive in the wake of Skena's death, and had even prepared him for burial. He fell asleep, Anubis came to him in a dream, and when he woke up, Gummy was on his chest, and had wiggled out of the linens he'd been wrapped in." Luka ran his hand back through his hair, brow furrowed in thought. "And you are certain Skena is dead?" "She smelled pretty dead," Arsast piped up. "Her blood and flesh always smell rotten, no matter the state of her health," Achoris said to Arsast. He hesitated a beat, then muttered, "...I'm just going to double-check." And he ducked away to head into where Skena's body was being held.
Daarka 7/21/2023 8:54 PM
Roll a medicine check from Achoris! !char achoris (!update if you need to) !c medicine (edited)
Avrae BOT 7/21/2023 8:55 PM
Achoris makes a Medicine check!
1d20 (3) + 2 = 5
Dakota 7/21/2023 8:55 PM
I don't suppose Ikiro can help with that
Daarka 7/21/2023 8:55 PM
If asked!
8:57 PM
As Achoris stepped into Skena's work room, he was immediately hit with a wall of odor. There was no denying the nasty stench of rotting meat, worse than it should have been for a body only a little over twenty-four hours dead. The figure inside the linen wrappings was not visibly moving, and some of the linens over the chest were slightly discolored, presumably from fluid leakage of the wound.
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:03 PM
Achoris crinkled up his nose and approached the shrouded body, gently drawing back the linens and attempting to do some basic life-checking things. Pulse, breath. He glanced at the canopic jars that were lined up and opened them to glance inside, making a slight retching noise. Yeah, those were still there. "Unless she's somehow able to be alive without her organs... Ikiro, are you able to do anything to check if there is in fact life force still lingering in her body somehow?"
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:09 PM
Hm... Seconds of contemplation ticked by, accompanied by the faint mutterings of the tabaxi under his breath as he worked through the rolladex of his arcana. ... Matters of lifeforce were never one of my particular fixations... he rattled after a moment, I have some boons I could grant you, but without knowing what exactly is being looked for, I cannot guarantee any of them would turn up anything. I think the best I can offer you that has a hope of being useful would be... temporary access to truesight... perhaps a temporary improvement on a relevant skillset... and... Hrn. I could dispel the magic of something, or remove a curse, but I am not positive one exists, necessarily. A beat. For whatever it's worth, this looks like a very, very, decidedly dead person to me. (edited)
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:14 PM
He clicked his tongue in contemplation. "Well, Jaska's brat has truesight. Doesn't he have some manner of affinity with lifeforce, too? Or the manipulation thereof?" The idea of going out and grabbing Jaska to help rankled, but... It was Skena. "I don't suppose you could improve that particular skillset of Jaska's if we have him take a look at her." His tone betrayed just how unenthused about the idea he was.
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:15 PM
Another, rather pompous little sniff. I could. A pause. ... You'd have to touch him.
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:21 PM
"Vile," Achoris grumbled. He heaved a very put upon sigh, which he promptly regretted with the thick stench of rot in the room. A slight gag and a spin of his heel, and he turned to march out of the room. "Jaska." The tiefling looked over at him with a glare, bristling instinctively. "What." "I need you to go in there and see if you can detect any lifeforce in her. For all intents and purposes she seems dead. She has several internal organs in jars beside her body, after all, and has no pulse or breath. But since lifeforce is something in your wheelhouse, you might be able to see something we can't. Having the child look at her with truesight wouldn't be amiss either. And if you'll allow me a brief moment of physical contact, I can have my patron give your capabilities a bit of a boost." Jaska ground his teeth, his tail lashing slightly. "For her, I'll permit it." He held out his hand to Achoris, who reached out to tap it with his finger long enough for Ikiro to cast the spell.
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:24 PM
Ikiro didn't dally; a strange tickle--that was almost akin to warmth, but perhaps a sensation more adjacent to it--prickled through the point of contact across Jaska's body, like a brief brush of pins and needles, though not painful. For the next hour, Jaska is proficient in Medicine. His modifier for those checks is now +6; (!char jaska > !update, etc) !r 1d20+6 or !c medicine -b 4
Avrae BOT 7/21/2023 9:25 PM
Jaska makes a Medicine check!
1d20 (14) + 2 + 4 = 20
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:31 PM
As Jaska entered Skena's work room--a place he may or may not have ever even step foot in previously--he would be met with the same sight and smell that had greeted Achoris, though the latter was one he wasn't wholly unfamiliar with, given his own bodily quirks. Skena looked gaunt and corpse-like in life, but somehow was even more so in death. Her eyes had been closed by Kaleva, her complexion inexplicably even more colorless than usual, her skeletal structures just slightly more pronounced as her skin had sunken around them. There was certainly no breath, no beating heart, and the only thing living in the room seemed to be the few flies that had gotten in and buzzed around her. Jaska was not typically in the business of simply feeling for the presence of lifeforce, but the circumstances made it important to try. And so he did his best to open his senses to the room, to let that part of him that was now well practiced at snatching fleeting souls up instead grope about the space for the existence of one at all. He only felt confident it was working in that there was the faintest glimmer of life he could barely discern from his daughter, who had shuffled in at his heels, still disinclined to be separated from him in her turmoil. But that was all. The body, the canopic jars, not even the specimens neatly organized around the room housed any such sign of life.
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:35 PM
Jaska... stared, uncomfortably, at Skena's body. It was one thing to hear about what happened, to know her body was in an adjacent room, but seeing it for himself brought an entirely new level of... feelings. Wretched and miserable, he let his hand gently hover over her body, the wound at her chest, and then finally placed his palm upon her brow. "...Axa. Do you see anything unusual?"
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:36 PM
Axa paused as she was addressed, before her gaze lifted to take in the body. It was... nearly impossible to say if it impacted her emotionally to any extent; she tolerated Skena comfortably, but it was much harder to ascertain if she had any fondness for the girl. A long silence stretched, before she murmured quietly, "... Her insides are missing."
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:40 PM
He exhaled quietly. "Yes... They have been removed and put in the jars. It's a funeral practice in Cusai. I don't know why they do it. Thank you, dear." Skena was given one last lingering look, brushing away the flies and covering her up once more. He then took Axa's hand and headed back out, shaking his head. "There's no doubt she's dead. Not a scrap of life force to be found in her body. Axa didn't detect anything we didn't already know."
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:42 PM
Valentine's eyes softened slightly at the sound of Jaska's voice. She wanted to give him a hug, but... she wouldn't put that upon him in front of all these people. Many of whom he was not comfortable around. Ingrid had gone to stand near Kaleva, frowning lightly at the news. "... Well that doesnae make a lick'a sense." A long pause, before she blinked, almost jolting. "--Kaleva, where are ye dogs?? How the shite did I nae notice before now??"
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:44 PM
Kaleva looked at Ingrid with the most tragic and miserable expression, opening the book back up to write in it. 'I think Atreyu took Song and Finch somewhere.' A pause. 'Atreyu thinks I killed Skena. He ran away.'
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:45 PM
Ingrid blinked as she read over that, before her expression twisted with compassion. "... Oh love. Aight, well... let's get that rectified. Ars, ye still antsy?"
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:47 PM
"Am I ever not?" Arsast trotted over, peeking at the writing, his shoulders sagging. "Oh. You want me to go find them for you?"
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:51 PM
"Ye feel up tae it? Here." In a little puff of shimmery purple magic, a black cat appeared in her waiting hands, her coat bearing a subtle violet sheen, and her eyes a very pretty shade of blue. Ingrid handed the cat over to Arsast. "If ye need anythin', or get lost, or want me tae reach out telepathically, let Delilah know. If she out'a range tae report back tae me, she can scurry away until she ain't. Atreyu understands common, aye?" She asked, glancing at Kaleva. "If ye find 'em, ye can explain what's happened tae him. Tell 'em his boy needs 'em back here, that we all workin' on a fix. He needs tae know Kaleva didnae do this. An' if anythin' happens back here, I'll reach out an' let ye know, yeah?" She tilted her head at her friend. "Ye donnae have tae do it if ye donnae want tae. Ah just know ye get restless when things ain't right. Might be a good way tae direct that, yeah?"
Dakota 7/21/2023 9:54 PM
Kaleva nodded confirmation that yes, Atreyu knew common. Arsast, meanwhile, perked up at the job. "Nono, I'm up for it! I have no idea where to even start looking though, but I figure I'll just try to find giant dog prints and follow those." He hefted Delilah onto his shoulder and started papping her bottom like he was burping a baby. "Good luck! I'll be back!" And with that, the satyr headed off out the door at a loping sprint.
Daarka 7/21/2023 9:59 PM
"Put that cunt tae work!" Ingrid called after him. "She got a damn nose, make her use it!!" As he clopped off, Ingrid took a deep breath, looking back to Kaleva. "... Well that's one thing we can take care of in the short term, then." Her brows furrowed softly, and she glanced at the hourglass. Just a little sand left, now. It maybe equated to an hour or so out of the twenty-four the full total of sand was meant to represent. "What do ye want tae do with this time, beloved? None of us... particularly know what happens when that runs out. I know ye donnae have any idea, either. But... feels like ye at least best equipped tae guess. So whatever ye think we should be doin', I want tae focus on that."
Dakota 7/21/2023 10:19 PM
Kaleva paused, looking around at all the people in his living room, looking a bit overwhelmed and lost. The quill hovered over the page for a minute or so, and then he slowly wrote out, 'I... don't know. I think when the sand runs out, Anubis will make His plans known. If this involves a quest of some kind... I'll need to know which of you are willing to come with me. Keep in mind, this may involve going to Hell. I can't stress enough how dangerous this will probably be.' As the contents of the book were made known, Achoris snorted. "Well I'm going, certainly." Jaska... froze. And when Kaleva and Achoris looked at him, the latter with quite the judgemental sneer on his face, Jaska grimaced and looked away. "...I cannot." "Don't care enough to risk your neck?" Achoris growled. "I want to go," Jaska snarled back, his lips curled back from his teeth. "But I can't. I can't do that to Axa." That gave Achoris pause, and he glanced at the devil child with a slight frown. Jaska drew Axa in against his side. "She has suffered enough at the hands of that place. I will not put her in a position to feel like she has to return there, nor will I make her worry as I potentially throw myself into the maw of the very place she has known so much torment." He drew in a sharp breath, it killed him to say it, but it was true. "I have to look after my daughter." Achoris made to say something, but Kaleva held up a hand to him, then walked over to Jaska. The pair of tieflings gazed at each other, and Kaleva reached out to place a gentle hand on Jaska's upper arm. He understood, and he didn't hold it against him. Jaska's features twitched into a flinch, and he tolerated the touch for a handful of seconds before exhaling sharply and tearing himself away. "In any case, we can provide resources from this end." He pulled off the ring that allowed him to communicate with Valentine, and turned to shove it onto Kaleva's finger. "Touch that gem to have it alert Valentine you need to speak with her. I'm not sure it'll work from different planes, but wherever you wind up, whatever happens, keep us appraised. And give me the ring back when you're done."
Daarka 7/21/2023 10:26 PM
Val listened along a moment, before drawing in a breath. "Keep your ring, Jaska. I can go in your place." Her attention shifted back to Kaleva. "He's right; Axa needs him, and it would be cruel for Jaska to either bring her to hell, or leave for hell without her. But I have ways of mitigating my blindness when it matters." A beat. "And I have gone toe to toe with entities more powerful than all of you combined in the past. And won. The lower planes do not scare me, and I will be able to maintain contact with my brothers back on the material. I may even be able to teleport us between planes... though I will need to make preparations ahead of time to be confident of that." It was important to Jaska. One of the most important things she had ever seen Jaska faced with. And there was nothing she would not do for her brothers. A moment passed, before Ingrid gently leaned her shoulder into Kaleva's side. "... Told ye I was in this for the long haul. Ye won't catch me flinchin' back now," she murmured easily.
Dakota 7/21/2023 10:53 PM
Kaleva removed the ring to hand back to Jaska, who took it back and replaced it on his finger, looking at Valentine with a barely suppressed look of pained gratitude. Not that she could see it, but she probably could sense it well enough. Achoris didn't look best pleased, but he didn't argue either, because even he could acknowledge that she would be useful. Luka opened his mouth, hesitated, and then said softly, "I'm not... great in combat. But I have healing spells. And I have a feeling that skill will be very useful." Also he could probably run interference between Achoris and Valentine as needed.
Daarka 7/21/2023 10:55 PM
Val gave a small nod to her twin, even as her tail slid out to gently brush Jaska's side. She would normally object to Luka going to literal hell--but with her there, she was reasonably confident she could keep him safe. Ingrid gently rubbed Kaleva's back. "We all in, in one way or another. I can pose the question tae Arsast when he gets back; wouldnae dare presume his response on somethin' so important, but if he doesnae go with, I know he'll help however he can back here."
Dakota 7/21/2023 11:03 PM
Kaleva exhaled and nodded, settling in with the group to wait. The sand had nearly run out when Arsast called out from outside, "Look who I found!" Kaleva immediately went outside, though he paused in the doorway to take a look at the very sad, very miserable, very cowed Cautican hound that barely even sniffed at his girl-crush Anouke, his eyes all for Kaleva in that moment. Kaleva sucked in a shaken breath, tears streaming down his face, and Atreyu let out a low whimper as he wiggled forward and started covering him with licks, his tail tucked and thumping between his back legs, nearly smushing Kaleva into the ground as he pressed up into his embrace and smothered him with doggy apologies.
Daarka 7/21/2023 11:04 PM
Ingrid bounded out after him to watch the reunion, her features warming with bittersweet relief. She looked around for Arsast, heading over to him when she spotted him to plant a kiss on his cheek. "Thank ye so much, beloved. Ye did perfect. Maybe one'a the most helpful things any of us have managed thus far."
Dakota 7/21/2023 11:06 PM
"Aw, he didn't go far," Arsast said with a grin as he slung his arm around Ingrid's middle. "It was a matter of convincing him not to run off and explaining to him what happened. Once he had things explained, I had to run to keep up with him as he ran right back here. So what's the plan?"
Daarka 7/21/2023 11:11 PM
Ingrid comfortably leaned back into him, watching the overgrown puppy make himself back at home in Kaleva's arms. Good. They needed each other. "Nae sure, love. Nae sure. First thing... I s'pose we waitin' for that hourglass tae run out. Probably just minutes left on that. Still nae sure what's comin' when it does. Kaleva doesnae know what's tae come, but thinks it's possible this is some quest, an' one that may involve a trip tae hell. Jaska cannae go 'cause he needs tae take care of his wee one, but all the rest of us have opted in." She looked over at him with--not the sultry bedroom eyes she so frequently wore, but a more earnest, deeper look of gentle affection. "No wrong answers, of course. If ye want tae join in, methinks ye be welcome. If ye prefer tae hold down the fort back here, that could prove plenty useful, s'well. An' in that case, I'll keep frequent contact any time this matter takes me away from home, an' we'll get it resolved and I'll be back before ye know it."
Dakota 7/21/2023 11:27 PM
Arsast thought about it for a minute, letting out a slight hum. "...Honestly? Think I'd probably be more use back here. And I'm pretty sure Dad would Actually kill me if I went to Hell. Or tie me to the bow of his ship. Or hand me over to Mother. But yeah, I'll help hold down the fort here. Let me know if you need me to call in the cavalry with Dad and the Moms."
Daarka 7/21/2023 11:28 PM
Ingrid chuckled softly. "Aye, cannae imagine that overgrown lizard thankin' me for draggin' ye tae hell." She looked back to Kaleva and Atreyu, sighing. "A'ight. We probably got mere minute 'til that thing finishes countin' down. Ye reckon we need tae... dunno, arm ourselves? Anythin' like that?"
Dakota 7/21/2023 11:37 PM
Kaleva nodded, already in his armor and with his weapons. He pushed himself to his feet and rubbed at Atreyu's ears before moving to saddle the hound up. Achoris poked his head out the door. "I've assembled rations for people. I'm not sure what else the rest of you need, but you'd best get it quickly." Luka patted the book in its holster at his hip. "Never leave home without it."
Daarka 7/21/2023 11:43 PM
Ingrid nodded. "Anythin' I'd need is a wee flick'a the wrist away." Valentine sighed softly. "I can also make do as I am," she murmured, shifting to ever so slightly lean her shoulder against Jaska's. She wanted to bundle him up in a hug almost more than she could bear, but she spared him for the time being. "Though before any planes-hopping adventures, I do want to go grab some reagents and brush up on some arcana quickly. It won't take long." A beat. "But if conflict is about to break out now, I am well equipped." She was unarmored, still in the casual clothes she was bartending in earlier, but her staff was in her hand, and that was more than enough. As everyone did whatever it was they felt necessary to do in those last moments, the grains of black sand continued to fall... until there were mere individual pieces in the top of the hourglass. And as the very last one slipped down through the funnel of glass, tumbling across the pile of its brethren at the bottom... There were three knocks at the front door.
Dakota 7/22/2023 3:21 PM
Jaska sullenly leaned his shoulder subtly against Valentine's. He hated that he couldn't go, hated it with every fibre of his being, but there was literally no way that he could take an active part in this that wouldn't be cruel to Axa... And if he couldn't, he was grateful that Valentine and Luka would. The knock had more than a couple of the people present twitching in surprise, but it was Kaleva who immediately went to the door, opening it to see who was on the other side.
Daarka 7/22/2023 3:39 PM
As Kaleva got up, Ingrid stood with him, following after him to hover near his back. If this was a threat, she wasn't going to be lounging in the other room while Kaleva faced it point blank. But as he opened the door, he would find the relatively un-threatening appearance of a woman. A stranger to him; she looked as though she might have been in her forties or so, but her long, slender ears betrayed her as an elf, so assuming her age was abstract at best, and likely translated to several centuries. Her skin was a light copper complexion, and she had long, thick brown hair that hung in gentle waves, neatly collected behind her shoulders. Her eyes were a gloomy shade of blue that provided unlikely but aesthetically pleasing contrast to her more melanistic-leaning complexion, and her expression already bore furrowed brows, twisted softly in a gentle concern as she looked over Kaleva, taking in his appearance for a brief moment. It wouldn't take long at all for him to find her attire--a mostly black sort of pantsuit, with breezy fabrics and an overcoat whose lengthy tails almost turned the outfit into a dress--just a little reminiscent of Cautican culture. On her shoulder sat what looked to be a melanistic barn owl, but she otherwise appeared to be alone. Her lips parted silently a moment, before she swallowed once, and then found her voice. "... You... You do not know me. But I know you, Kaleva. And I am... to an extent, aware of what has happened. I can help." A beat. "... May I come inside?" (re: outfit - see image for design, but all black instead of white.) (edited)
SPOILER
SPOILER
SPOILER
Avrae BOT 7/22/2023 3:46 PM
Achoris makes a History check!
1d20 (12) + 0 = 12
Dakota 7/22/2023 3:51 PM
Kaleva looked her over, visibly a bit tense, his lips pressed into a thin line and the hair on his nape half-bristled. Understandable, given his history with Cautica, and Skena's. But no one in Cautica was supposed to know where Skena lived, and her arrival perfectly coincided with the sands of Anubis' hourglass. After a moment, he gave her a small nod, and stepped aside to motion her in. Achoris blinked and arched a brow at her arrival, standing a bit straighter and lifting his chin. "Well, well. And what interest do you have in all this?"
Daarka 7/22/2023 4:01 PM
She dipped her head, stepping inside and looking around briefly at those gathered--but her gaze did ultimately settle on Achoris as he addressed her. She didn't look remotely surprised to see him, for whatever reason, and she gave him a small smile that... had too much behind it to be fully conveyed. "... Much the same as the rest of you, I imagine," she replied after a moment, her words... slowly drifting off as something seemed to catch her eye. She stared... not at Achoris, but at the ruby atop his collar, squinting ever so slightly as if confused. Uncertain. Questioning. (edited)
Dakota 7/22/2023 4:05 PM
"Really." Achoris stepped forward to tower over her, looming in all his spindly glory, silky black locks cascading down over his shoulders to nearly frame them both. "And who is Skena to you?" It put the ruby nearly at eye height to her. Kaleva's tail flicked a bit in uncertainty, not sure if he should interfere. But if she was sent by Anubis to help... He stepped forward, gently resting his fingers to the crook of Achoris' arm in a quelling motion.
Daarka 7/22/2023 4:11 PM
The woman's eyes were still locked on the ruby, and it almost seemed like she didn't even hear Achoris. Then she suddenly blinked, sucking in a short breath. "... Ikiro?!" In his mind, Achoris heard the tabaxi nearly choke himself with a shocked breath of his own, hacking and wheezing in surprise. Through his graceless sounds of trying not to suffocate from lungs that had been shocked into malfunctioning, he choked a hiss of, ... Amunet??
Dakota 7/22/2023 4:14 PM
Achoris jerked back, his features twisted into a possessive scowl. "Oh that's lovely. And what exactly are you two to each other?" He put a bit of distance between them, like he thought she might reach out and snatch the ruby from the bolo tie around his neck, leaving Kaleva standing there with arm half-lifted, looking confused. Jaska, meanwhile, watched with the half-smirk of someone who had finally found something amusing out of this whole situation.
Daarka 7/22/2023 4:18 PM
Amunet did not reach for the ruby, nor did she seem to react as though she had heard Ikiro's response. But at Achoris' reaction, seemingly confirming her guess, her expression warmed into shocked surprise, and delighted relief. "... So this is where you've been, all this time," she marveled quietly, finally glancing at Achoris' face, before looking back to the ruby. "... I greatly look forward to catching up with you, old friend. But... that must wait a little while longer." His hacking now under control, Ikiro sat in stunned silence. And then, with absolute conviction, he murmured to Achoris, Trust her. Implicitly. Amunet still showed no signs of having heard Ikiro, and had turned her attention back to Kaleva after she spoke. "I apologize. I came as quickly as I could, but I was many countries away when this happened. Have you tried to resurrect her?"
Dakota 7/22/2023 4:24 PM
Achoris stiffened briefly at Ikiro's words, then furrowed his brow in thought, looking over Amunet with a different sort of consideration. At her question, Kaleva drew in a breath, but as before, the words lodged in his throat like a chicken bone, and he couldn't find the ability to vocalize. He let out a short exhale and a slight shake of his head. Picking up the book again, he opened it and wrote down, 'The sword that killed her was enchanted to send anything it kills directly to Hell to be made into a lemure. But her body is repose and will be kept from deteriorating. We had the means to attempt to summon the lemure she was supposedly turned into, as well as a means to contain it, but the spell failed in a manner that indicates she might not actually have been changed to a lemure.'
Daarka 7/22/2023 4:36 PM
Amunet looked momentarily confused by Kaleva's muteness, but did not question it, tilting her head to read what he wrote, before nodding easily. Then pausing, and looking back at the page to squint, and read over it again. She sucked in a deep, mildly awed breath as she processed it more clearly. "... Then I am... glad, beyond words, for choices made decades ago. I ask of resurrection only because I would reimburse you any materials wasted in such pursuits--and that offer remains if anything of value was consumed in your summoning attempt. I do not mean to beat around the bush, though: resurrection would have failed, and your... lemure-related efforts have failed, because Skena is not deceased." As she spoke, she reached into her sleeve, pulling forth what looked to be a shard of marbled ivory, and she very briefly looked around, before stepping towards a mostly empty wall in the home, and reaching out to hold the shard at about eye level. She then withdrew her hand--and the shard remained where she had left it, inexplicably hovering as if stuck in some invisible material, just a couple inches away from the wall. "Many years ago, those who cared for her created a failsafe, should a terrible fate befall her. The hope was that it would never find use, but as with most preventative measures, it is, as they say, better safe than sorry. That cannot be emphasized enough if what you have shared with me is the circumstance of her death." (edited)
Dakota 7/22/2023 4:49 PM
Kaleva stiffened, torn between both relief and a newfound terror. He quickly wrote with a hand that trembled so badly it was almost illegible. 'Please tell me she's not with Oberon.'
Daarka 7/22/2023 4:57 PM
Amunet paused, glancing over to him to read, before giving him a sympathetic look. "No, darling. No. She is safe and sound with me. I am taking you to her now." With nimble, practiced motions, arcane symbols were carved through the air in deliberate shapes around the suspended shard of ivory. "I prioritized traveling here as quickly as possible, and so I could not spare the magic to visit her until this point. Doing so would have delayed my ability to bring her back to you, and my assumption was that prioritizing that would have been mutually preferred. She should have received some information of her circumstances--but while I highly doubt her soul even brushed hell during the transitional period, I have no such doubt that her experience has been stressful. I wish I could have offered you both comfort in this interim, but I endeavored to expedite my travels, instead. I do apologize for your suffering in this time," she murmured gently, and with a last delicate and seemingly innocuous wave of her hand, a warm, white shimmer of light subtly flashed over a plane of space centered on that shard. Her hand then gently swept through the air, as if brushing aside a curtain. And as if, in fact, an unseen curtain had been brushed aside, a portal appeared where the "curtain" had previously covered, like Amunet had brushed aside a veil of reality to reveal something extraplanar peeking through. "Come; you have waited long enough as it is." (edited)
Dakota 7/22/2023 5:04 PM
He drew in a shaken breath, tears building in his eyes, and he immediately went for the portal - only to be stopped by Jaska's hand reaching out and snatching his wrist, the other tiefling's distrustful glare focused on Amunet. "How did you know to come here? Achoris asked questions of you, and I believe we deserve answers. Who is Skena to you?" "Ikiro says she can be trusted implicitly," Achoris spoke up, less hostile than he'd previously been. "Lovely, but before any of us go traipsing off into the unknown, I think we should know exactly what we're getting into--" Kaleva squirmed out of Jaska's grasp, breaking free of his hold and bolting through the portal before he could be stopped again, and Atreyu was quick to follow after, nearly bowling Jaska over in the process.
Daarka 7/22/2023 5:04 PM
Amunet paused, giving Jaska an understanding look. "... Please--I will explain. But it would be cruel to dally further. Let me deliver on my promises first," she murmured, the words becoming a bit rushed as Kaleva and Atreyu darted past her and into the portal (the poor dog only barely fit through the rather traditionally doorway-sized entrance). She gave Jaska another, slightly pleading look, before stepping through after Kaleva, the portal remaining seemingly open and able to be passed through by all who remained on the original side of it. ‚Å†ÿú (edited)
5:11 PM
Skena sucked in a ragged gasp--and promptly choked as some sort of liquid nearly entered her lungs as a result. Her body jolted, eyes opening to darkness, and the jolt of her body bumping her into the close confines surrounding her. She was laying supine--maybe?--submerged in a fluid, with something enshrouding her on all sides. Like a coffin. With no small amount of bewildered panic, she instinctively planted her hands on the surface above her and tried to shove against it, her back pressed into the surface behind her to brace herself in doing so. Relief washed through her as that surface moved easily, even for her meager strength, lifting without much difficulty. She immediately twisted to push her head up in the air this exposed, gasping in a proper breath as her face surfaced from the liquid. Something about her body felt... raw. Perhaps more fragile than usual. As her lungs rapidly coursed fresh breath through her body, they expanded and contracted in a way that was almost inherently strenuous. But very little of her mind was focused on that, as she shoved the top surface of her confinement off to the side; it seemed like a long pane of glass, maybe only half an inch thick, similarly heavy as glass would be, but not too much so for her to maneuver it with a bit of effort. When she had room to fully sit up and attempt to further extract herself, her gaze finally lifted to the space around her, even as she continued to move to try to crawl out of her current position. She was... immediately unsettled to find herself lying in what appeared to be a sarcophagus, but with a glass-like lid instead of its usual manner of securing such an object closed. It was a little larger than would be necessary to accommodate Skena's size, but not much more; it would have been hard-pressed to fit even an average-sized humanoid. And that immediate sense of specification gripped Skena's gut in a way she bristled at. Unlike the sarcophagi she had worked around (and directly with) most of her life, this one looked to be mostly filled with a relatively clear liquid, of a water-like consistency, which had neatly filled in all the empty space that her body had not taken up. Her body, which was entirely unclothed and unadorned, and which faintly ached in protest as Skena scrambled out of what felt too much like a setup for a premature burial. She was already half-launched out of the sarcophagus, her limbs more wobbly than she wanted them to be as she crawled over the edge and onto the floor, as she turned her attention to her surroundings at large. And... she didn't know exactly what to make of them. It was a very dimly-lit room. An... oddly cozy room, if not particularly furnished. Skena wasn't sure what she'd been expecting to see after such an awakening, but the elegant rug in the center of the floor, an end table near the sarcophagus (as if the entombment was a bed, and the furniture its bedside table), a small, backless seat off to the side, and a simple leather trunk against the far wall were not it. But it did leave very little for her attention to be pulled towards, so inevitably, she noticed what lay upon the finely-crafted end table. Still dripping wet, she stared a long moment at a neatly folded, cream-colored towel that looked to be of notably fine quality where it was stacked atop something else that looked to be made of fabric beneath it. And beside them both... a simple but elegant fold of parchment, sealed in black wax. It bore no stamped insignia, no hint at who might have set out the stationary. Just black wax, a conspicuous note, and a towel... She slowly reached for the towel, barely breathing as her mind raced. The question of Where am I? was obvious, but the memory of what had come immediately before was a more gradual, dawning realization. As she drew the towel towards her--it was luxuriously soft--she stilled, her gaze unfocused and breath suspended as she remembered. She was dead.
5:11 PM
She didn't remember feeling pain. Maybe that was nice. ...Was it actually nice, though? A part of her realized she didn't particularly care if it had been painful; the pain was the farthest thing from her mind. Why did everyone always put so much emphasis on deaths being painless, as if that made it humane? There was... a discomfort, that feeling of bodily wrongness as the sword plunged through her sternum and out her back. She simply hadn't lived long enough for her brain to comprehend it should have felt the horrible pain of such an injury. She remembered... some distant awareness that the sword must have gone through her heart. That she had precious few seconds of consciousness left. But she had been... shocked. Too shocked to do a damn thing with those last seconds of life. She stood--barely--staggered from the physical impact of the blow, staring at her attacker. Staring in confusion, in bewilderment. She had not been fighting them. She had been staring right at them--and still had no idea what was coming. As she swayed on her feet, she still didn't know what had happened. Her gaze slid to the weapon, to the hilt of the sword embedded in her. It was uncanny, to see it somewhere it so grievously did not belong. Then, recognition. As the world spun around her and darkness creeped at the edges of her vision, her gut twisted in horror. The scrambling desperation that set in entirely too late. This can't be how... She still felt no pain, but the sword running her through felt like it was burning the flesh around it. She didn't remember falling, but she was now looking up at her attacker--her murderer--from the ground, through the rapidly growing darkness. She was never going to see Kaleva again. She wasn't even going to see Anubis again. She was going to burn in hell. She wondered how much the soul of a devout aasimar cleric and daughter to a celestial deity would be worth in hell. She assumed it would be a high value. And yet, it'd be indistinguishable from the lemures that had been common criminals and lowlifes in the end. If she was lucky, her reward for a good life would not be eternal paradise, but the hope that those she left behind would remember her fondly. The almost idle philosophy of it all passed through her mind in less time than it took for her skewered heart to attempt--and fail--its last pulse. And as the darkness clotted out her vision, her limbs feeling like ice while the blade in her chest only rose in scalding heat... she was consumed with crushing guilt. She was leaving Kaleva. She was leaving him alone, forever, in the most inconsolable manner possible. It would have been kinder to him if she had just never reentered his life for the second time, if this was how it was going to end. She hoped he would somehow forgive her. But she didn't forgive herself. And then there was nothing, save for the burning metal in her heart. She... vaguely remembered strange, fleeting sensations. Like a particularly ambiguous dream that became harder to comprehend the more one tried to focus on any one detail. The passage of time was impossible to discern, if any passed at all. Then, gasping in dark water. Skena stood, still dripping, now shaking, holding a towel she had entirely forgotten about. She didn't even realize that her other hand had lifted to clutch at the space over her heart, reflexively wanting to--claw? shield? as the memories crashed sickeningly through her. But there was no sword there now. Not even marred flesh. Slowly, she blinked back to the present, her face blank in horror as she took in her surroundings a second time. And she knew she was in hell. There was no fire and brimstone. She... didn't look to be a lemure. But she knew what that sword did. She knew she had died. And so it was a matter of waiting for the other shoe to drop, wasn't it? How very believable that damnation would be cruel enough to look nearly comforting at first.
5:11 PM
She breathed now only because she would start to pass out otherwise, but her breaths were shallow and panicked. She... didn't know what to do. She stared at the towel in her hand. She remembered stories of mortals who found themselves in the realms of fiends and accepted things offered to them, cementing their damnation as a result. Or were those stories of the fey? She--couldn't remember. Her mind was racing too fast. What were the semantics of those bindings?? Was it eating what was offered to you? Or would--using this towel be a contractual entrapment? But as she stood there for a small eternity, nothing... happened. No little imps manifested to heckle her. She heard nothing at all from beyond her current position. She was still shaking like a leaf. So she... gingerly, at first... drew the towel nearer, beginning to blot herself off with it. Still no fiendish appearances. She suddenly felt on the verge of tears as the stress reached a critical mass in her tiny body, shaking almost to the point of being incapable of using her hands effectively. After a while, just seeking some measure of comfort, she properly unfurled the towel and wrapped it around herself, huddling there in a shivery mess for a long while. Her gaze landed on the letter again. It took a bit of scrounging up what nonexistent courage she had available, before tentatively freeing a hand to pick it up, slowly sinking down to sit on the floor right where she was. She stared at it for a long moment--even turned it over, but nothing was written on the back side--before clumsily prying the wax seal free. Something faintly popped as she did so, like a small pressure of some unusual sort had been released. It felt... magical. And Skena tensed at that, clenching her jaw and freezing. But again... nothing happened. When it was evident nothing was going to happen, she swallowed tightly, forcing as deep a breath as she could manage, and fumbled open the folded paper to read what was written within. It was hand-written in elegant, neat script in plain black ink. At the top was her own name.
5:12 PM
Skena, You are safe. You surely have many questions. I will try to address the most immediate ones I can predict. First and foremost: you are not dead.
